taglines: [u'The Bowden family has moved to New Essex.', u'He learned to read.', u"There is nothing in the dark that isn't there in the light. Except fear.", u"Sam Bowden has always provided for his family's future. But the past is coming back to haunt them."]
trivia: [u"The thick accent Robert De Niro used to play Max Cady reportedly gave Martin Scorsese the creeps. As a joke, De Niro would call Scorsese's house, leaving voicemails as Cady.", u'Robert De Niro was tattooed with vegetable dyes, which fade after a few months.', u'The scene in the high school auditorium was totally ad-libbed by Robert De Niro and Juliette Lewis, and done on the first take.', u'Martin Scorsese read the original script three times while making Goodfellas (1990) and hated it each time because of how the Bowdens were a happy family and wanted them to be miserable.', u'Robert De Niro did a lot of working out several months before the movie and during the shoot to make him the muscular Max Cady, reportedly taking his body fat down to only 3%.', u'Robert De Niro researched sexual predator crimes for the part and suggested the scene where his character bites the victim.', u'Robert De Niro paid a dentist $5,000 to make his teeth look suitably bad for the role of Max Cady. After filming, he paid $20,000 to have them fixed.', u"Director Martin Scorsese's first choice for the role of Bowden was Harrison Ford. He had Robert De Niro call Ford to try convincing him to take the part.", u'Drew Barrymore tested for the role of Danielle Bowden but failed the audition. She later said she had "acted all over the place and it was just the biggest disaster of my life."', u"This was Gregory Peck's final appearance in a theatrical film release before his death on June 12, 2003 at the age of 87.", u"Robert De Niro's Cady accent came from an earlier role where he played a southerner. To prepare for the role, De Niro took excerpts of the script and a tape recorder into southern towns and would ask locals to read the lines into the tape.", u'Steven Spielberg was originally set to direct. He later recommended Martin Scorsese for the job and personally called the director, letting him know that this was a commercial film that had potential to be a hit, which would exercise more power for Scorsese to make his films.', u'Originally in the scene where Cady puts handcuffs on Lori, she was supposed to start freaking out, Illeana Douglas was the one who came up with the idea of having her character laughing and trying to play along instead.', u'The auditorium scene was originally scripted as a chase scene, but Martin Scorsese wanted it to be a seduction.', u'Unlike Nick Nolte and Robert De Niro, Gregory Peck and Robert Mitchum did not get along well with each other off screen while filming Cape Fear (1962) years prior. Notably, despite their small roles in the remake, Peck and Mitchum do not appear in any scenes together.', u'Juliette Lewis developed a crush on Robert De Niro during the scene in the drama class.', u'The scene between Robert De Niro and Juliette Lewis in the school was shot in three takes, but the first one was used in final productions.', u'In the original script, Leigh only met Max Cady at the end. Jessica Lange suggested the scene where they talk outside her house be added to the script, because she felt there should be a meeting between the two before the climax.', u"Gregory Peck, who starred in Cape Fear (1962), appears as Cady's lawyer. Robert Mitchum played Max Cady in the 1962 version, and appears as Lieutenant Elgart. Martin Balsam played Mark Dutton in the 1962 version and the judge in this version.", u"The score by Elmer Bernstein is not only an arrangement of Bernard Herrmann's original Cape Fear (1962) score, but also includes parts of Herrmann's unused score for Torn Curtain (1966).", u'Both Robert De Niro and Nick Nolte had to alter their physiques for the film because the 6\'0", bulky, Nolte is clearly larger than the 5\'9", slimmer De Niro. Nolte slimmed down, losing a good deal of weight, while shooting the film and De Niro bulked up his muscles considerably until De Niro could be seen as Nolte\'s physical superior. Interestingly the original Sam Bowden (Gregory Peck 6\'3" at his peak) was also slightly taller than the original Max Cady (Robert Mitchum 6\'1" at his peak).', u'Reese Witherspoon auditioned for the role of Danielle Bowden.', u'The climax was filmed inside a 90-foot water-tank on a soundstage. It took four weeks to shoot.', u'When Steven Spielberg was attached to direct he had plans on casting Bill Murray as Max Cady.', u'Christina Applegate did an audition for the role of Danielle, but had to turn down the part due to conflicts from Married with Children (1986) producer Ron Leavitt.', u"Alyssa Milano was offered the role of Danielle but had to turn down the role, due to pressure from fellow Who's the Boss? (1984) cast member Tony Danza.", u'The climactic scene out in the swamp was filmed in John U. Lloyd State Park, in the middle of a mangrove swamp. A tropical depression set over the set for four days, so the film crew had to wait for the storm to stop so that they could make their own rain.', u"In the auditorium scene between Robert De Niro and Juliette Lewis, it was De Niro's idea to put his thumb in her mouth.", u"Robert De Niro helped costume designer Rita Ryack choose Cady's clothing.", u'It took a year to convince Martin Scorsese to make this movie.', u'Robert De Niro played scenes with Kevin Kline and Phoebe Cates in the Sam and Danielle roles for Martin Scorsese when De Niro was trying to interest him in directing the film.', u'George C. Scott was originally supposed to play the Lieutenant role. But because of health problems he dropped out a few days before filming and Robert Mitchum was brought in.', u"For the first time in Martin Scorsese's career, he allowed the screenwriter, Wesley Strick, on the set during filming.", u"Martin Scorsese wanted the Bowdens' house surrounded by oak trees, covered by hanging tufts of Spanish moss. He wanted it so it looked like a sunny oasis by day, and isolating by night. Therefore, it would make a perfect dark cover for Cady.", u"Robert De Niro and Illeana Douglas's scenes were improvised.", u'Filmed in 17 weeks in South Florida.', u'During the opening sequence Max Cady is seen working out in his cell and the camera pans over his jail time reading material. One of the books featured is The Cell Within by Jake Manning. This is not a published work and only exists as part of a Miami Vice (1984) storyline. In Miami Vice: The Cell Within (1989), Tubbs is tormented and imprisoned by the author Jake Manning, an ex-con he helped convict years before.', u'The scene where Robert De Niro sits on the brick wall, he actually sits in front of a blue screen where the fireworks were added later in production.', u'Jennifer Connelly and Winona Ryder both turned down the role of Danielle.', u'Martin Scorsese directed the film as part of a two picture deal with Universal Studio because of their help and support with the release of The Last Temptation of Christ (1988). The other picture in the deal was Casino (1995).', u'Gregory Peck completed filming his cameo scenes in one day.', u"Robert Richardson auditioned for the position of cinematographer but lost out to Britain's Freddie Francis. Martin Scorsese, a staunch admirer of Richardson's work with his former NYU student Oliver Stone, remembered Richardson when he was preparing to direct Casino (1995).", u"Robert Mitchum feared in comparing his character of Max Cady to Robert De Niro's portrayal in the film. He had never seen either movies.", u"The music that is heard at the climax of the movie was a piece of music that Bernard Herrmann had written for Alfred Hitchcock's Torn Curtain (1966), but that piece of music was never used. Elmer Bernstein had always liked that original score and he asked Martin Scorsese if it could be used in the film.", u'Robert Redford was also considered for the role of Sam Bowden.', u'The ice cream parlor scene was shot in the first week of production where the owners complained for the first three days that they were losing business.', u'This was Amblin Entertainment\'s first "R" rated film.', u'The script went through 24 drafts.', u"Diane Keaton met with Martin Scorsese and Robert De Niro to discuss playing the role of Leigh Bowden, but didn't win the part.", u'Nicole Kidman lobbied for the role of Danielle, but Martin Scorsese wanted a younger actress.', u'Illeana Douglas based her performance as Lori Davis on Jennifer Levin, who was murdered in 1986 in Central Park by Robert Chambers (whom the press dubbed the "Preppy Murderer").', u'This is the first film that Martin Scorsese uses optical FX.', u'The music video that Danielle watches to avoid her parents\' argument is Jane\'s Addiction\'s "Been Caught Stealing."', u'This was the first film Martin Scorsese shot in the wider 2.39:1 aspect ratio, as opposed to the taller 1.85:1 ratio in which he had filmed all his previous works (excluding New York, New York (1977), which was shot in 1.66:1).', u'The film cast includes four Oscar winners: Robert De Niro, Jessica Lange, Martin Balsam, Gregory Peck; and three Oscar nominees: Nick Nolte, Robert Mitchum and Juliette Lewis.', u"Former wrestler Dan Spivey's short-lived 1995 WWE gimmick Waylon Mercy was based on Max Cady. Windham Rotunda's WWE gimmick Bray Wyatt has elements of Waylon Mercy and thus is influenced by Max Cady by default.", u'There is an iconic shooting star scene; an apparent nod to Steven Spielberg.', u'Martin Scorsese had also wanted Telly Savalas to return from the original cast.', u'Sarah Jessica Parker was originally cast as Danielle.', u'Brad Dourif was considered to play Max Cady.', u'Lori, talking with Max, says, "Now weren\'t I the bozo on this bus!" - a reference to the 1971 album by The Firesign Theatre called "I Think We\'re All Bozos on this Bus". A reference like this may seem against period, but Martin Scorsese, like the Firesign Theatre players, was part of the counter-culture scene of the \'60s and early \'70s. Considered with other elements in the script, such as the lax attitude toward marijuana, this doesn\'t seem so out of character.', u'Jessica Lange accepted her role to work with Robert De Niro and Martin Scorsese.', u'David Johansen was considered for the role of Max Cady.', u'The opening of the movie is very similar to the opening of Hitchcock\'s "Vertigo" both visually (the red/black fade of female face) and musically (Elmer Bernstein emulating Bernard Hermann\'s original score).', u'When Max Cady tells Bowden to "check out the Bible, Councilor, the Book between Esther and Psalms," he\'s referring to the Book of Job. This is its placement in the Christian Bible. In the original Hebrew Bible, the Book of Job is in between Proverbs and Song of Songs, the latter being the first of the Five Megillot (Scrolls).', u'Shannen Doherty, Nicole Eggert, Bridget Fonda, Jodie Foster, Helen Hunt, Diane Lane, Demi Moore, Molly Ringwald, Meg Ryan, Winona Ryder, Brooke Shields and Tiffani Thiessen were considered for Danielle Bowden.', u'Nicole Eggert auditioned for the role of Danielle but turned it down.', u'Lori Davis (Illeana Douglas) was named after Lori Martin, who played Nancy Bowden in Cape Fear (1962).', u'Sole collaboration between longtime friends and New Hollywood trailblazers Martin Scorsese and Steven Spielberg. Spielberg oversaw development of the project via Amblin Entertainment, although he is uncredited on the film itself.', u"Another music video shown on Danielle's TV is The Bog, of the band Bigod 20.", u'Sam Bowden and Max Cady are the only characters to retain the same names from Cape Fear (1962).', u"The film was released two days before Martin Scorsese's 49th birthday.", u'Fangoria magazine was barred from covering the film because Universal, Steven Spielberg, and Martin Scorsese saw the film as a thriller, not a horror film. They were also barred from covering The Silence of the Lambs (1991) for similar reasons.', u'A picture of James Dean is shown when Danielle (Juliette Lewis) slams the door while her parents argue.', u"The note that is broken on Nick Nolte's grand piano is an A two octaves above middle C.", u'Robert Mitchum as the Southern policeman Lieut. Elgart casually says of Cady, "If he\'s unemployed, he gotta have money, or we\'ll bust him for vagrancy." Mitchum was himself charged with vagrancy in Savannah as a young man.', u'Both the 1962 and 1991 film adaptations of Cape Fear, formerly titled "The Executioners", omit Sam Bowden\'s two young sons Jamie and Bucky.', u'Martin Scorsese: [mother] fruit stand customer.', u'When Cady strangles Kersek with the piano wire, Steven Spielberg suggested he be dressed up as the housekeeper while doing it.', u"Robert De Niro would only get under the Bowdens' car if a stuntman could prove it could be done.", u"During Cady's death scene, he seems to be talking gibberish. He's actually speaking in tongues, elated at the fact that he thinks he's ascending to Heaven.", u'Body count: 5 (including the dog).']
release_dates: [u'USA::15 November 1991', u'Japan::21 December 1991', u'Australia::9 January 1992', u'Germany::21 February 1992 (Berlin International Film Festival)', u'Argentina::27 February 1992', u'Germany::27 February 1992', u'Finland::28 February 1992', u'Belgium::March 1992 (Brussels International Festival of Fantasy Films)', u'Italy::4 March 1992', u'Norway::5 March 1992', u'Denmark::6 March 1992', u'UK::6 March 1992', u'Greece::6 March 1992', u'Portugal::6 March 1992', u'Sweden::6 March 1992', u'Spain::11 March 1992', u'Netherlands::13 March 1992', u'France::18 March 1992', u'Brazil::27 March 1992', u'Hungary::3 April 1992', u'Ireland::3 April 1992', u'France::October 1997 (Montpellier Mediterranean Film Festival)', u'France::21 October 2015 (re-release)']

title: We're No Angels
plot_outline: Two escaped cons only prayer to escape is to pass themselves off as priests and pass by the police blockade at the border into the safety of Canada.
keywords: [u'priest', u'police', u'con', u'convict', u'escape', u'religious', u'fake-priest', u'disguised-as-a-priest', u'impersonating-a-priest', u'catholic-church', u'catholic-priest', u'catholic', u'claim-in-title', u'lingerie-slip', u'foreign-language-adaptation', u'monk', u'monastery', u'mistaken-identity', u'friendship', u'fish-out-of-water', u'captive', u'assumed-identity', u'prison', u'religion', u'remake', u'based-on-play']
taglines: [u"Escaped convicts disguised as priests. It'll take a miracle to get away with this one.", u'The con is on.', u'The Cons Are Loose and The Comedy Is In!', u'It Will Be A Sin To Miss It!']
trivia: [u'The fictional 1930s Depression-era town of Brandon, in which the film takes place, was designed by Wolf Kroeger and built from scratch in Canada. According to the TCMDb, "the set cost $2,500,000, the largest film set ever constructed in Canada".', u'Final cinema movie of actor Ray McAnally to whom the movie is dedicated.', u"The film's two lead stars and friends, Robert De Niro and Sean Penn both share the same birthday of 17th August. Coincidentally further, the pair are born approximately seventeen years apart, in 1943 and 1960 respectively, the number of years between being the same as their mutual birth date of the month.", u'This was the first film that Neil Jordan directed in which he did not also act as a credited writer.', u'The name of the festival in the town was "The Feast of Our Lady of Sorrows". The festivity is a real life religious event. Wikipedia states "The feast of the Our Lady of Sorrows was originated by a provincial synod of Cologne in 1413 as a response to the iconoclast Hussites. It was designated for the Friday after the third Sunday after Easter. It had the title: Commemoratio angustiae et doloris B. Mariae V.. Before the 16th century, the feast was celebrated only in parts of northern Europe".', u'The film was originally planned to have an R rating. But during the first week of shooting, the studio changed the aimed rating from R to PG-13 to attract a wider audience.', u'First soley American film for a major Hollywood studio for Irish director Neil Jordan.', u"The movie's producer Art Linson once said that this picture was very loosely based on some ideas in the original We're No Angels (1955).", u'On the closing scene as Ned, Molly and Rosie have crossed the bridge, the billboard in the distance reads, "Valley Forge." No known reference is noted as to the product it advertises.', u'This remake of We\'re No Angels (1955) is based on three sources: (1) The original 1955 movie We\'re No Angels (1955); (2) the American play, "My Three Angels", written by Bella Spewack and Sam Spewack; and (3) the French play, "La Cuisine Des Anges", written by Albert Husson, the American play in turn also being based on the French play.', u'In this 1989 movie which debuted at the end of the 1980s decade, actor Robert De Niro plays a convict who impersonates a priest. In 1981, at the start of the 1980s decade, de Niro had portrayed a priest in True Confessions (1981). Later, de Niro played a priest again in Sleepers (1996).', u'The movie\'s storyline features "The Weeping Madonna". Sean Penn was once married to Madonna between 1985-1989. Penn also once starred in a movie called Crackers (1984) which was a remake of in Big Deal on Madonna Street (1958) (Big Deal on Madonna Street).', u'According to the TCMDb, the movie is "the biggest budgeted in British Columbia\'s history".', u'The film was made and released about thirty-six years after its source American play "My Three Angels" by Bella Spewack and Sam Spewack had been first performed in 1953.', u'The picture\'s source stage-play "My 3 Angels" by Bella Spewack and Sam Spewack opened on Broadway on 11th March 1953 where it ran for 344 performances until 2nd January 1954. The season was directed by Jos\xe9 Ferrer. The play\'s setting according to its introduction was: "The Ducotel\'s living-room back of a general store in Cayenne, French Guiana. December 1910. Christmas Eve".', u"One of two comedies where the two male lead characters impersonate members of the clergy which launched within three months of each other in the USA during 1989-1990. The movies are We're No Angels (1989) which debuted December 1989 in the USA where 'Robert de Niro' and Sean Penn pretended to be priests and Nuns on the Run (1990) which opened stateside March 1990 where Eric Idle and Robbie Coltrane hid-out dressed up as nuns.", u"This movie and Brian De Palma's Casualties of War (1989) were the first two theatrical feature films of actor John C. Reilly who in this picture portrayed a young monk.", u'The name of the prison was the "Black Ridge State Penitentiary".', u'You may have not noticed, but the birettas (the black square hats with three peaks) worn by these phoney priests are not worn correctly. The hat is to be worn so that the part of the hat without the peak is to be worn to the left. Each "priest" wears them differently and wrong. None of the other true priests recognize the error. I\'m sure this is part of the comedy, though subtle.', u'Writer-director David Mamet wrote the screenplay but did not direct this picture, it being directed by Neil Jordan. By the time that this feature film started lensing, Mamet had directed two cinema movies, Things Change (1988) and House of Games (1987).', u'According to the \'Video & DVD Guide\', the film is a "send-up of the old Warner Bros. gangster melodramas".', u'The picture was filmed during February, March, April and May 1989.', u'The movie was made and released about thirty-seven years after its source French play "La Cuisine Des Anges" by Albert Husson had been first performed in 1952.', u'Both Sean Penn and Robert De Niro underplay their parts as dim-witted convicts whilst James Russo and Demi Moore overplay their parts.', u'The movie\'s opening title card reads: "U.S.A. 1935. A state penitentiary near the Canadian border".', u'Second of three movies that actors Bruno Kirby and Robert De Niro both appear in. The first was The Godfather: Part II (1974) where De Niro played the young Vito Corleone and Kirby portrayed the young Clemenza. The two also both appear in Sleepers (1996) even though they did not share any scenes.', u'One of thee theatrical feature films starring actor Robert De Niro first released in 1989 with the others being Jacknife (1989) and Stanley & Iris (1990).', u'Final film directed by Neil Jordan to receive a PG-13 classification rating certificate in the USA from the MPAA (Motion Picture Association of America) until Ondine (2009) around twenty years later.', u'One of the most famous movie quotations that Robert De Niro is famous for, and perhaps the most of all, was his "You talkin\' to me? You talkin\' to me? You talkin\' to me?" repetitive line of dialogue by his Travis Bickle character in Martin Scorsese\'s Taxi Driver (1976). Similarly, at one point in We\'re No Angels (1989), Demi Moore repeatedly says to de Niro, "Are you gonna give me those things? Are you gonna give me those things?".', u"This 1989 movie was made and released about thirty-four years after the original We're No Angels (1955) had premiered in cinemas."]
release_dates: [u'Canada::15 December 1989', u'USA::15 December 1989', u'Argentina::25 January 1990', u'Japan::10 February 1990', u'France::28 February 1990', u'Taiwan::3 March 1990', u'Spain::24 April 1990', u'Belgium::25 April 1990', u'Italy::May 1990', u'Finland::1 June 1990', u'UK::1 June 1990', u'Portugal::2 June 1990', u'Hungary::14 June 1990', u'Denmark::3 August 1990', u'Australia::16 August 1990', u'Germany::20 February 1991 (video premiere)', u'Turkey::8 March 1991', u'Sweden::14 January 1997 (TV premiere)', u'France::15 October 1997 (Cherbourg-Octeville Festival of Irish and British Film)']

title: The Irishman
plot_outline: A mob hit man recalls his possible involvement with the slaying of Jimmy Hoffa.
keywords: [u'mob', u'nickname-in-title', u'gun', u'reference-to-jimmy-hoffa', u'irish-american', u'life', u'destruction', u'death', u'daughter', u'contract-killer', u'house', u'paint', u'hitman', u'thugs', u'italian-mafia', u'union', u'teamsters', u'regret', u'killing', u'aging', u'cgi', u'flashback', u'gangster', u'italian', u'mafioso', u'mafia', u'two-word-title', u'based-on-book']
taglines: [u"It looks like we don't have any Taglines for this title yet."]
trivia: [u'This is the first feature film directed by Martin Scorsese to star Robert De Niro since Casino (1995).', u'Ray Liotta expressed interest in playing a role in the movie.', u"According to Robert De Niro, the movie will use 'Benjamin Button' style effects to make him and other actors look younger during flashback scenes.", u"Al Pacino was offered the role of Jimmy Conway in Martin Scorsese's Goodfellas (1990). He has regretted turning down that role ever since.", u"Al Pacino was Martin Scorsese's first choice for the role of Frank Costello in The Departed (2006).", u"Joe Pesci's first film since Love Ranch (2010).", u"This is the fifth Martin Scorsese film that is about an Irish mobster. The other films are: Goodfellas (1990), Casino (1995), Gangs of New York (2002), & The Departed (2006). The main characters in Casino were Jewish and Italian. Dogs was Irish and he's in the movie for a grand total of three minutes.", u'In 2003, while on his deathbed Frank \'The Irishman\' Sheeran revealed that he killed Jimmy Hoffa, stating that it was really hard on him because Hoffa was his good friend, but "it was business." This has yet to be confirmed as a fact by the authorities.', u'When asked during interview with Cinema Blend about how will the film handle the age difference between the actor(s) and character(s), producer Gast\xf3n Pavlovich stated, "You don\'t use prosthetics, make-up; they have acting and the technology is able to have them go through different time ages without the prosthetics. So, we\'ve seen some tests and it looks extraordinarily. We were able to film Bob (Robert De Niro) and just do a scene, we saw it come down to when he was like 20, 40, 60, so we\'re looking forward to that, from that point of view, for The Irishman... imagine seeing what De Niro looked like in The Godfather: Part II (1974) days, that\'s pretty much how you\'re going to see him again." The technology will be utilized for the other actors in the film.', u'At one point, it was conceived as being a two part film.', u'Filming is set to begin in January 2017.', u'The seventh film featuring Robert De Niro and Joe Pesci. They previously starred together in Raging Bull (1980), Once Upon a Time in America (1984), Goodfellas (1990), Casino (1995), A Bronx Tale (1993) and The Good Shepherd (2006), these last two films were also directed by Robert De Niro.', u'This is the ninth feature film collaboration from director Martin Scorsese & actor Robert De Niro with their prior films being: Mean Streets (1973), Taxi Driver (1976), New York, New York (1977), _Raging Bull (1980), The King of Comedy (1982), Goodfellas (1990), Cape Fear (1991) & Casino (1995). However, there is a tenth film collaboration, if you take in account the short film, The Audition (2015).', u"This is Martin Scorsese's 25th theatrical motion picture.", u'This is the fourth film collaboration between actors Robert De Niro and Al Pacino; they previously starred together in The Godfather: Part II (1974), Heat (1995), & Righteous Kill (2008).', u'The budget is for the film is set at $100 million.', u'Robert De Niro said that the film represents "unfinished business" between Martin Scorsese and himself.', u'As of May 15th, 2016, STX Entertainment bought the international distribution rights of the film. After this, the project was green-lit to start production. Scorsese pitched the project as far back as 2007.', u"Initially set up at Paramount, who was planning to release it domestically, as well as Media Asia who picked up Chinese distribution, and STX Entertainment, who took international rights. After Paramount lost confidence in the film's $100 million budget, in tandem with the departure of studio chief Brad Grey, it was put in turnaround and Netflix acquired the rights.", u'According to Deadline, before accepting taking on the role of Russell Bufalino, Joe Pesci refused multiple times to come out retirement in order to appear in this film. Some sources say the actual number of refusals was 50.', u"The sixth film where Martin Scorsese directs Harvey Keitel, after Who's That Knocking at My Door (1967), Mean Streets (1973), Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore (1974), Taxi Driver (1976) and The Last Temptation of Christ (1988).", u'During an interview with The Playlist, Martin Scorsese teased that this would be different from his other gangster films, saying "I think this is different, I think it is. I admit that there are - you know, Goodfellas (1990) and Casino (1995) have a certain style that I created for them - it\'s on the page in the script actually. Putting Goodfellas together was almost like an afterthought, at times he was kind of rushing, he felt I\'d already done it because he\'d played it all out in terms of the camera moves and the editing and that sort of thing. The style of the picture, the cuts, the freeze-frames, all of this was planned way in advanced, but here it\'s a little different. The people are also older in The Irishman, it\'s certainly more about looking back, a retrospective so to speak of man\'s life and the choices that he\'s had to make."', u'The relatively new production company, STX, secured international rights on the movie. They are a young studio focused on making mid-budget, adult-targeted, star-powered films - which include The Gift (2015), The Boy (2016), and Hardcore (2015).', u'The first collaboration between Al Pacino and Martin Scorsese.', u'Rumor has it that Leonardo DiCaprio will cameo in three scenes as Robert F. Kennedy, who was Attorney General during key times throughout the story.', u'The second Martin Scorsese film designed by Dante Ferretti starring Robert De Niro and Joe Pesci, the prior film being Casino (1995).', u'This will be the fourth film in which Martin Scorsese will direct Robert De Niro and Joe Pesci in a movie after Raging Bull (1980), Goodfellas (1990) and Casino (1995).', u'According to Deadline, the movie has been in development since 2010.', u'The eighth film featuring Robert De Niro and Harvey Keitel. They previously starred together in Mean Streets (1973), Taxi Driver (1976), Falling in Love (1984), Cop Land (1997), The Bridge of San Luis Rey (2004), Little Fockers (2010) and The Comedian (2016). The tenth film including their "voice only" roles in Arthur and the Invisibles (2006) and Dear America: Letters Home from Vietnam (1987) are taken into account.', u'The seventh film featuring Robert De Niro and Joe Pesci. They previously starred together in Raging Bull (1980), Once Upon a Time in America (1984), Goodfellas (1990)_, A Bronx Tale (1993), Casino (1995), The Good Shepherd (2006)_.', u"In this film Robert De Niro's character ,Frank Sheeran, has a couple encounters with a guy named Dave Ferrie. Dave Ferrie was portrayed by Joe Pesci in the 1991 Oliver Stone film JFK. Pesci will now play Pennsylvania mob boss Russell Bufalino in this film.", u'The fourth collaboration between Martin Scorsese and Rodrigo Prieto, after The Wolf of Wall Street (2013), The Audition (2015) and Silence (2016)', u'Second collaboration between director Martin Scorsese and actor Ray Romano. They previously worked together on the HBO series Vinyl (2016).', u'Stephen Graham previously worked with Martin Scorsese and Steve Zaillian on Gangs of New York (2002).', u'The Irishman is the first film Martin Scorsese and Joe Pesci have collaborated on together without actor Frank Vincent.', u"In addition to their close call on Goodfellas (1990), Al Pacino (I)' was almost directed by Martin Scorsese when Francis Ford Coppola, a fellow apprentice to Roger Corman, suggested he direct The Godfather: Part II (1974) after seeing Mean Streets (1973). Paramount head Robert Evans, however, felt Scorsese was not experienced enough for the job and preferred that Coppola direct himself.", u'Third collaboration between Martin Scorsese and Bobby Cannavale and their first film together. Cannavale starred on Boardwalk Empire (2010) and Vinyl (2016), both of which Scorsese produced and directed the pilots for.', u'The film cast includes four Oscar winners: Robert De Niro, Al Pacino, Anna Paquin and Joe Pesci; and one Oscar nominee: Harvey Keitel.', u'This film will be debut in 2018 which is the 40th Anniversary year of the same titled but unrelated 1978 Australian film of the same name The Irishman (1978).']

title: War with Grandpa
plot_outline: Upset that he has to share the room he loves with his grandfather, Peter decides to declare war in an attempt to get it back.

title: The Wizard of Lies
plot_outline: A chronicle of 's Ponzi scheme, which defrauded his clients of billions of dollars.
taglines: [u'Only those you trust can truly betray you.']
trivia: [u'In order to prepare for her role, Michelle Pfeiffer spent some time with the real Ruth Madoff.', u'This is one of two films focusing on Bernie Madoff made in 2016. The other is Madoff (2016). Both films are TV productions.', u"This is the fourth film in which Robert De Niro and Michelle Pfeiffer have appeared together. They previously starred alongside each other in Stardust (2007), New Year's Eve (2011) and The Family (2013)(where they also played husband and wife).", u'This is the fourth collaboration between Barry Levinson and Robert De Niro. Together, they made Sleepers (1996), Wag the Dog (1997) and What Just Happened (2008).', u'Bernie Madoff and Michelle Pfeiffer have the same birthday, April 29.', u'Robert De Niro and Kathrine Narducci previously appeared together in A Bronx Tale (1993).', u'Robert De Niro and Alessandro Nivola previously appeared together in American Hustle (2013).', u'This marks the second time Lily Rabe and Kristen Connolly have worked together. They previously appeared together in The Whispers (2015).', u'Kristen Connelly and Nathan Darrow previously starred on House of Cards (2013-) with one another.', u'The scene in which Mark shifts the blinds up and down and makes phone calls in his kitchen before committing suicide was improvised by Alessandro Nivola and Barry Levinson; none of it was in the script. As Nivola recalls, "Barry had finished the shoot day in my apartment, and we were sitting around like, \'Well, what do we do now?\' We both read somewhere that, in the last days before he killed himself, [Mark] had started making phone calls to his brother and to their lawyer, relentlessly, recounting to them things that he had read in the tabloids about them and all of this media vilification of them. He would call them so much that they stopped taking the calls, so he just started leaving messages, constantly, where he would alternately be in a total rage, and then incredibly calm, apologetic and rational seeming. So, we decided to shoot something like that. Barry just set up the camera in the kitchen and he gave me this phone and said, \'I\'ll just run the camera and you start making some calls.\' I improvised for an hour, and just started calling, over and over and over again. He filmed it all, and then he cut it together in that great final frenetic little montage of conversations. That was all just something that Barry had suggested that we try on the fly because he bought so much time by being so efficient."']
release_dates: [u'USA::11 May 2017 (MoMa, New York City)', u'USA::20 May 2017', u'Australia::21 May 2017', u'Hungary::28 May 2017', u'UK::1 June 2017', u'Germany::10 July 2017', u'Japan::27 August 2017', u'Poland::18 September 2017 (Gdynia Polish Film Festival)', u'Italy::22 September 2017']

title: The Comedian
plot_outline: A look at the life of an aging insult comic named Jack Burke.
keywords: [u'has-been', u'stand-up-comedy', u'contempt-of-court', u'locked-in-jail', u'olive', u'wedding-reception', u'heckler', u'man-wearing-a-tuxedo', u'woman-wearing-a-red-dress', u'poker-game', u'cameo-appearance', u'reference-to-jackie-gleason', u'celebrity-roast', u'heart-attack', u'bare-chested-male', u'crawfish', u'reference-to-stevie-wonder', u'obscene-finger-gesture', u'pregnant', u'walking-in-the-rain-with-an-umbrella', u'comedy-club', u'laughing', u'cheering-crowd', u'flash-forward']
taglines: [u"nobody's a bargain"]
trivia: [u'When Sean Penn was on-board to direct the movie, Kristen Wiig was cast in the lead role. She was later replaced by Jennifer Aniston. However, Aniston later dropped out due to scheduling conflicts and Leslie Mann was cast.', u'Robert De Niro has been trying to make this movie for 8 years.', u"De Niro was trained by comedian Jessica Kirson and adopted one of her signature 'moves': talking to herself sotto voce while turned away from the audience. He didn't take the move quite as far, preferring to cover his face with his hand while turning slightly to one side. Kirson appears in the film longer than any other standup comic, but she is not shown using this technique.", u'The Comedian is the first movie Robert De Niro and Danny De Vito have appeared in together.', u'The second movie in which Robert De Niro will play a comedian. The other movie was The King of Comedy.', u'Filmed in 27 days with very long filming hours. The wedding scene was filmed around 3 AM.', u'Sean Penn and Mike Newell both considered directing this movie at different times.', u'The seventh film featuring Robert De Niro and Harvey Keitel. They previously starred together in "Mean Streets", "Taxi Driver", "Falling in Love", "Copland" "The Bridge of San Luis Rey"and "Little Fockers", The ninth film if their "voice only" roles in "Arthur and the Minimoys"and "Dear America: Letters from Vietnam" are taken into account.', u'For the screenplay, Art Linson and Richard LaGravenese wrote the drama while Jeff Ross and Lewis Friedman wrote the comedy routines.', u"At the beginning of the film Jackie is seen going from Penn Station out to Long Island where he enters Governors Comedy club. This is the club that Judd Apatow, Leslie Mann's husband in real life, performed at the beginning of his career. In Jackies character makes fun of Hicksville NY. This is a real town and is next to Syosset the town Apatow grew up in.", u'Robert De Niro portrays an "insult comic", not unlike Don Rickles. De Niro and Rickles starred together in "Casino" (1995).', u'Danny De Vito and Patti Lupone also played husband and wife in the film Wise Guys(1986).', u'Billy Crystal\'s cameo in the elevator with De Niro brings the "Analyze This" duo together again.', u'At one point it was hoped that Martin Scorsese would direct the film. However, this did not come to pass.', u'In October 2016, Sony Pictures Classics acquired U.S distribution rights to the film, with plans to release the film in December, in order to qualify for awards.', u'The film opened to negative reviews from critics.', u'In North America, The Comedian was released alongside Rings and The Space Between Us, and was projected to gross $1-3 million from about 800 theaters in its opening weekend. It ended up debuting to just $892,021, finishing 21st at the box office.', u"Danny DeVito's real-life daughter Lucy DeVito plays his daughter in the movie.", u"Robert De Niro and Charles Grodin appeared before together in the 1988 classic action comedy Midnight Run, which launched Robert De Niro's comedic career. Lois Smith also appeared in both films.", u'Robert De Niro, Harvey Keitel and Edie Falco appeared in Copland (1997)', u'The film had its world premiere at the AFI Fest on November 11, 2016 and was released on December 9, 2016, by Sony Pictures Classics.']
release_dates: [u'USA::11 November 2016 (AFI Fest)', u'USA::9 December 2016 (limited)', u'USA::15 January 2017 (Palm Springs International Film Festival)', u'Canada::3 February 2017 (limited)', u'USA::3 February 2017', u'Germany::31 August 2017']

title: Hands of Stone
plot_outline: The legendary Roberto Duran and his equally legendary trainer Ray Arcel change each other's lives.
keywords: [u'rematch', u'1980s', u'boxing', u'sex-scene', u'fight', u'boxing-match', u'hunger', u'1970s', u'bare-breasts', u'panama', u'boxer', u'three-word-title', u'buttocks', u'ass', u'butt', u'female-nudity', u'nudity', u'breasts', u'violence', u'ends-with-biographical-notes', u'what-happened-to-epilogue', u'childbirth', u'kiss', u'comeback', u'strategy', u'training', u'flashback', u'pool', u'rivalry', u'blonde', u'husband-wife-relationship', u'father-son-relationship', u'subtitles', u'bare-chested-male', u'rags-to-riches', u'male-rear-nudity', u'year-1980', u'title-spoken-by-character']
taglines: [u'No mas. No surrender.', u'The Triumphant True Story']
trivia: [u'Robert De Niro met the real Ray Arcel around the time he appeared in Raging Bull.', u'Edgar Ramirez and Robert De Niro previously starred together in "Joy" (2015). De Niro played Ramirez\' father-in-law.', u'Frankie Carbo, John Turturro\'s character, is the real-life mob boss and boxing czar on whom the character "Tommy Como" was based in Raging Bull, which also starred Robert De Niro.', u'The fourth movie Robert De Niro has appeared in that has to do with boxing. The other three movies are Raging Bull, Night and the City, and Grudge Match.', u'Al Pacino was the first choice to play Ray Arcel before Robert De Niro was cast.', u'Movie was filmed in Panam\xe1 which is where Roberto Duran was born and raised', u'During the height of his career, Roberto Duran was known to be very generous. Often handing out money to the poor in panama. He saw himself as robin hood, helping the poor. Which is why he did name one of his kids, Robin.', u'Marks the 9th movie that Robert De Niro has co-starred in with his daughter Drena De Niro.', u'Gael Garcia Bernal was first cast as Roberto Duran. After he dropped out, Edgar Ramirez assumed the character', u'In 1991, Ray Arcel became the first trainer to be admitted to the International Boxing Hall of Fame.', u"Roberto Duran owns a restaurant in Panama where he's known for being prone to sing.", u"Robin Dur\xe1n, Roberto Dur\xe1n's real life son, makes a cameo in the movie in the scene when Dur\xe1n finds out that General Omar Torrijos was killed.", u'This is the third movie that Robert De Niro and Ellen Barkin worked on together. Their first movie was "This Boy\'s Life" (1993), followed by "The Fan" (1996).', u'The sound track includes many songs from the singer Ruben Blades, who acts in the movie.', u'Al Pacino was the first choice to play Ray Arcel before he left the role and Robert De Niro took over.', u"In the first meeting between Roberto Duran and Sugar Ray Leonard, judge Angelo Poletti's scorecard had been inaccurately announced as 147-147, as portrayed in the movie (giving a majority decision to Duran). A few hours later, the score was rectified as 148-147 in favor of Duran, giving him a unanimous decision winner.", u"Robert De Niro's second movie titled 'Stone'."]

taglines: [u"This is Jason. He's a little worried about his grandpa.", u"They're hitting the road. And everything on it.", u'Lose your way. Find your manhood.', u'What did you learn from your grandparents?', u'Naughty is relative.']
trivia: [u"For the film's theatrical poster, Robert De Niro lifted Zac Efron on his back without any help. Efron confirmed it while promoting the film on Instagram.", u'Aubrey Plaza, who plays a twenty-one-year-old college student, was thirty-one when the film was released.', u"Zac Efron performed all of his own nude scenes, except for the embarrassing beach sequence. Director John Phillips states on the commentary that it was one of the most expensive scenes to make in the film. Zac wasn't actually nude at all, and wore flesh-colored briefs, which were edited out during post-production. A stunt penis was also placed over his crotch using CGI for the split-second frames where he is most exposed. Phillips mentioned that when the restricted German trailer was released to the internet, that a community of online fans were trying to grab frames of the actor's penis. Subsequently, it turns out this is the one nude scene in the film, that isn't actually him.", u'The screenplay was featured in the 2011 Blacklist, a list of the "most liked" unmade scripts of the year.', u'The Florida spring break beach scene was shot in Tybee Island, Georgia.', u'The original poster art references the poster used for The Graduate (1967).', u'Jeff Bridges and Michael Douglas were considered for the role of Dick Kelly.', u"In Neighbors (2014), Zac Efron dressed up as Robert De Niro's character Travis Bickle from Taxi Driver (1976).", u'Aubrey Plaza has said that she accepted the role of Lenore because it was different from the characters she usually played, and because she wanted to engage in physical comedy.', u'The first of two back-to-back films starring Zac Efron and Aubrey Plaza. The second is Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates (2016).', u'Robert De Niro was not involved in the promotional circuit.', u'Aubrey Plaza, Jason Mantzoukas, and Mo Collins were also in Parks and Recreation (2009).', u'Zac Efron and Robert DeNiro previously starred in New Years Eve (2011) although they shared no scenes.', u'Screenwriter John Phillips has a cameo as an outraged guest in the wedding rehearsal scene.', u'Zac Efron character uses a Nikon D3300 in the movie.', u'The RX# on the Xanax bottle is 8675309.', u'This is the second time Zac Efron has played a character named Jason. The first was in That Awkward Moment (2014).', u'Zac Efron used a body double for the naked motorcycle riding scene.']

taglines: [u'In America the ordinary needs the extraordinary every single day.']
trivia: [u'Joan Rivers is portrayed in this film by her real life daughter Melissa Rivers. Director David O. Russell actually asked Melissa for input on dialogue written for her mother, particularly in the scene where she gives Joy clothing feedback.', u"Despite earlier reports, this movie is not a biography of Joy Mangano. Annie Mumolo's original script was based on Mangano, an Italian-American inventor and entrepreneur known for inventions such as the self-wringing Miracle Mop and Huggable Hangers. She is the president of Ingenious Designs, appears regularly on US television shopping channel HSN, and holds more than 100 patents. When David O. Russell came onto the project, he added many more supporting characters and interwove Mangano's original biography with stories of other women changing their lives. Russell admitted he was in no hurry to meet Mangano in real life during filming because he wanted to make the movie his own way. He only spoke to Mangano on the phone. Joy's last name is never mentioned in the film, and she is not a native of Smithtown, NY, on Long Island's north shore.", u"In real life, Joy's ex-husband, Tony Miranne, was a fellow business student and former classmate at Pace University, not a Venezuelan singer.", u'Final film of Ken Howard.', u'Diane Ladd was decided to be the narrator of the story after she had already filmed all her scenes.', u"Virginia Madsen's character, Terry, is a composite of several people in Joy Mangano's life.", u'When Joy is getting ready at the QVC studios, Lori Greiner is getting her makeup done. She is considered the Queen of QVC.', u"Joy's half-sister, Peggy, is entirely fictional.", u"Jennifer Lawrence wore wigs and hairpieces for the majority of filming. While doing Joy's haircut scene, she accidentally snipped some of her own hair as well as the fake hairpieces. The whole haircut was done in one take.", u'The fourth collaboration between Bradley Cooper and Jennifer Lawrence. They previously starred together in Silver Linings Playbook (2012), American Hustle (2013), and Serena (2014).', u'The fictional soap opera that Terry watches features soap opera stars such as Susan Lucci, Maurice Benard, Laura Wright and Donna Mills.', u"Under David O. Russell's direction, Robert De Niro, Bradley Cooper, and Jennifer Lawrence have all been nominated for Academy Awards. Lawrence won for Silver Linings Playbook.", u"Except for Neil Walker, none of the principals' last names are ever stated.", u'The red wine brought onto the boat, which inspired the creation of the Miracle Mop, appears to be a 1975 Mouton Rothschild "Andy Warhol." In 2015 it sold for about $400 per bottle.', u"This is the third David O Russell film where Jennifer Lawrence has played a character significantly older than she is in real life. In Silver Lining's Playbook, her character Tiffany was married for several years (and was in her forties in the original book) - placing her in her mid-to late twenties (Jennifer being twenty-one at the time of filming). In American Hustle, Rosalyn's real life counterpart was in her forties, and had been a mother for several years. Joy Mangano didn't start selling her inventions until she was thirty, while Jennifer was five years younger during filming.", u"Filming took place in Boston, Massachusetts. Haverhill, Massachusetts was also used for filming. In July 2015, downtown Haverhill was transformed into 1980's Dallas. The Dallas Music Center from the movie was the former home of the Haverhill Music Center. David O. Russell's previous film, American Hustle, was filmed in various locations around the state notably Worcester.", u'Working title was "Kay\'s Baptism".', u'Joy (Jennifer Lawrence) is the daughter of Rudy (Robert De Niro). Joy tours the shopping channel studios and meets the celebrity presenters, who are played by Drena De Niro (the real-life daughter of Robert De Niro) and Melissa Rivers (the real-life daughter of Joan Rivers).', u"Jennifer Lawrence and Elisabeth Rohm had previously starred together in American Hustle, playing two women who hit it off and become friends. At one point Elisabeth's character Dolly has to calm down Jennifer's Rosalyn when she acts out and nearly ruins everything. Here their roles are inverted - playing sisters who hate each other, with Elisabeth Rohm playing the brat and Jennifer Lawrence the level-headed one.", u"Elisabeth R\xf6hm was cast as Jennifer Lawrence's sister, making this the second collaboration between her, Jennifer, Bradley Cooper, and Robert De Niro under David O. Russell's direction.", u"David O. Russell's second film not to receive an R-rating. He disowned the first, Accidental Love (2015), after creative and financial disagreements.", u'First film produced by Annapurna Pictures to receive a PG-13 rating, and 12A in the UK.', u'In this movie, Edgar Ramirez looks up to Tom Jones and in one scene is singing the song "Mama told me not to come" by Three dog night. The movie Domino stars Edgar Ramierez and features The song "Mama told me not to come" covered by Tom Jones.', u'The film cast includes two Oscar winners: Jennifer Lawrence and Robert De Niro; and three Oscar nominees: Bradley Cooper, Diane Ladd and Virginia Madsen.', u'Isabella Rossellini and Diane Ladd co-star in this film and also co-starred in Wild at Heart.', u'Drena De Niro had a small role in the film.', u'David O. Russell and Bradley Cooper third film together.', u'Robert De Niro and David O. Russell third film together.', u'David O. Russell and Jennifer Lawrence third film together.', u'Bradley cooper and Robert De Niro worked in two movies together "Silver linings playbook" and "Limitless".']

title: Heist
plot_outline: A father is without the means to pay for his daughter's medical treatment. As a last resort, he partners with a greedy co-worker to rob a casino. When things go awry they're forced to hijack a city bus.
keywords: [u'casino', u'bus', u'riverboat', u'honda', u'land-rover', u'chevrolet-cruze', u'chevrolet', u'ford-crown-victoria', u'ford', u'heist', u'father-daughter-relationship', u'sick-child', u'policewoman', u'strong-female-character', u'die-hard-scenario']
taglines: [u"Never make a bet you can't afford to lose."]
trivia: [u'Filmed in and around Mobile, Alabama.', u"Even though this film's plot is centered around a casino robbery, gambling is actually illegal in Alabama.", u"This was Mark-Paul Gosselaar's first movie role in fourteen years.", u'Gina Carano and Dave Bautista have both starred in Marvel-based films. Carano as "Angel Dust" in Deadpool (2016), and Bautista as "Drax the Destroyer" in the Guardians of the Galaxy franchise', u'Some scenes, when the bus is moving, were filmed while the bus was being pulled by a big rig truck off of Interstate 165 onto Water Street, in downtown Mobile, Alabama. Another scene on the interstate, was filmed on Interstate 10. Interstates 10 and 165 run through Mobile, Alabama. Also, on the final day of shooting, a scene was filmed in a vacant gravel parking lot right outside the Alabama State Port.', u'There are seven casinos in Alabama, they do not have table games.', u'At around three minutes, The Pope says "bat\'s not always the answer." In The Untouchables (1987), Al Capone pulls out a baseball bat at a dinner party and suddenly beats one of his men to death. The Pope and Al Capone were played by Robert De Niro.', u"Scott Mann is from the same Woodham Comprehensive stable as authors George Mann, Paul Magrs, and actor Mark Gatiss. Nicknamed 'La Masia' within the industry, in recognition of its similarity to Barcelona's extraordinary talent production line, Woodham Comprehensive continues to support film and literature in the UK.", u'A trailer for this movie was leaked in early 2015.', u'The second heist film starring Robert De Niro and being directed by someone with the last name Mann, the first being Heat (1995).', u'D.B. Sweeney and Gina Carrano appeared in Extraction (2015).', u'After Vaughn (Jeffrey Dean Morgan) makes it to Galveston, Texas to pick up the plane, he is surprised by Dog (Michael Chestnut). Dog says "Eat rock salt", and proceeds to shoot Vaughn in the chest with a shotgun filled with rock salt. Jeffrey Dean Morgan is also well known for playing "John Winchester" on the CW series Supernatural (2005), which consistently features characters that carry shotguns loaded with rock salt.', u'Although in the movie, the bus is shown traveling to Texas, the entire movie was filmed in Mobile, Alabama.']

title: The Audition
plot_outline: and  must compete for the lead role in 's next film.
keywords: [u'casino', u'two-word-title', u'rivalry', u'gambling', u'actors', u'audition']
taglines: [u"It looks like we don't have any Taglines for this title yet."]
trivia: [u'The lead actors reportedly received a $13 million fee each for the 2-days-shoot.', u"Although this is a short film, this marks the 9th collaboration between Martin Scorsese and Robert De Niro, the 6th collaboration between Martin Scorsese and Leonardo Dicaprio, the 3rd Collaboration between Robert De Niro and Leonardo Dicaprio (after This Boy's Life and Marvin's Room), the first collaboration between Robert De Niro and Martin Scorsese in 20 years (since Casino in 1995) and the first time that Martin Scorsese, Robert De Niro and Leonardo Dicaprio have all worked together.", u'First time Robert De Niro, Leonardo DiCaprio and Brad Pitt are in one film together.', u'This is the first time that Leonardo DiCaprio and Robert De Niro appear together in a film by Martin Scorsese.', u'The Audition (2015) is an advertisement for two new Asian casinos - Studio City in Macau, China, and City of Dreams in Manila, Philippines. This is the most expensive advertisement ever produced. It reportedly had a budget of $70 million, topping the previous record of $33 million set by Chanel.', u'This marks as the second collaboration between Robert De Niro and Brad Pitt. They previously appeared in Sleepers (1996).', u'The cast includes four Academy Award winners (Brad Pitt, Robert De Niro, Martin Scorsese, Leonardo DiCaprio) and one Academy Award nominee (Rodrigo Prieto).', u'Director Martin Scorsese and writer Terence Winter worked together on Boardwalk Empire (2010), Vinyl (2016) and The Wolf of Wall Street (2013).']
release_dates: [u'South Korea::3 October 2015 (Busan International Film Festival)', u'China::27 October 2015 (internet)', u'Japan::9 June 2016 (Short Shorts Film Festival & Asia)']

title: The Intern
plot_outline: 70-year-old widower Ben Whittaker has discovered that retirement isn't all it's cracked up to be. Seizing an opportunity to get back in the game, he becomes a senior intern at an online fashion site, founded and run by Jules Ostin.
keywords: [u'website', u'f-rated', u'reference-to-jack-nicholson', u'reference-to-george-clooney', u'reference-to-ben-affleck', u'reference-to-brad-pitt', u'reference-to-billie-holiday', u'reference-to-youtube', u'reference-to-harry-potter', u'reference-to-google', u'mother-daughter-relationship', u'brooklyn-new-york-city', u'woman', u'office', u'san-francisco-california', u'hotel', u'reference-to-harrison-ford', u'police-siren', u'bar', u'reference-to-jay-z', u'reference-to-beyonce', u'reference-to-facebook', u'rapping-in-a-car', u'singing-in-a-car']
taglines: [u'Experience never gets old.']
trivia: [u"In one scene, Robert De Niro's character is confused as to who Jay Z is. This is an in-joke about the beef Robert De Niro and Jay-Z have had since 2012.", u"Nancy Meyers approached Jack Nicholson for the role of Ben Whittaker. Nicholson is mentioned in Jules' philosophic rambling at the bar.", u'Reese Witherspoon was originally cast as Jules, but dropped out.', u'This is the third time Robert De Niro and Rene Russo have starred together. They previously appeared together in The Adventures of Rocky & Bullwinkle (2000) and Showtime (2002).', u'This was once set up at Paramount Pictures with Tina Fey starring.', u'In Anne Hathaway\'s opening scene, she\'s filling an order over the phone for a bride named "Rachel." This recalls the title of her earlier film Rachel Getting Married (2008), where she was nominated for a Best Actress Oscar.', u'One plot point has Jules\' (Anne Hathaway ) board of directors pressuring her to bring in a more experienced CEO, referencing the real-life Gilt Group having done the same. Later, when Jules is preparing to interview the first potential CEO, she mentions that he "had a successful run at Travelocity." In real-life, the Gilt Group CEO that the board would have been referring to, was former Travelocity CEO Michelle Peluso.', u"In the movie, Robert De Niro's character attended Northwestern college, the same college Anne Hathaway's character, in The Devil Wears Prada (2006) attended.", u'Adam Devine and Anders Holm are the leads in Workaholics (2011).', u"One of Jules' employees is named Mia. This is a reference to the The Princess Diaries (2001) movies, where Anne Hathaway plays Princess Mia.", u"Linda Lavin and Celia Weston shared no screentime together, but were on Lavin's CBS series Alice (1976)", u'The movie is identical to Intern (2000) starring Dominique Swain, that follows a young intern in a very "The Devil Wears Prada" story-line. Anne Hathaway played a similar wide-eyed intern in The Devil Wears Prada (2006).', u'Director Quentin Tarantino named The Intern one of his favorite movies of 2015.', u"When driving in the car with Ben for the first time, Jules (Anne Hathaway ) is discussing new CEOs, and the man she's meeting with is named Atwood. In Limitless (2011), (in which Robert De Niro starred) the CEO of his competition's company is named Hank Atwood. This could possibly be a nod to Robert De Niro's previous film.", u'Anne Hathaway previously starred in The Devil Wears Prada (2006), which has a similar setting (a New York City fashion office).', u'The first time Nancy Meyers and Robert De Niro worked together.', u"Ben's flip phone shown at the beginning of the movie, is a Samsung Gusto 3, a phone designated for Verizon prepaid customers.", u"In the scene when Ben and Jules set up his Facebook profile, in the section of favorite books he mentions Harry Potter among other writers. In The Devil Wears Prada (2006), Anne Hathaway as Streep's secretary, had to rush and find the original next Harry Potter books before they were to be published, just to satisfy her boss' twin children.", u"When Ben and Jules are eating pizza and setting up Ben's Facebook account in the warehouse, they are drinking Stella Artois beer.", u"Drena De Niro: Robert De Niro's daughter plays the hotel manager.", u'Robert De Niro and Anne Hathaway learned Tai Chi from Tiffany Chen, the daughter of Grandmaster William C. C. Chen.', u"The movie Ben and Jules watch together in her hotel room is Singin' in the Rain (1952).", u'When Ben and his co-workers go to steal a computer from Jules\' mother\'s house, they have been told that the key is "under the flower pot", only to discover dozens of flower pots. This situation is similar to one where Anne Hathaway\'s The Devil Wears Prada (2006) character finds herself in when she is told to leave "the book" on the "table with the flowers", finding many different possibilities.', u"When Ben and his colleagues break into a house to erase an e-mail, and the alarm starts, and sirens can be heard of approaching police cars, Ben comments that they have at least thirty seconds to get out. This could be a nod to Robert De Niro's character in Heat (1995), who lives by the rule, that you must be able to drop everything in your life within thirty seconds when the heat comes, if you want to survive as a criminal."]

title: Grudge Match
plot_outline: A pair of aging boxing rivals are coaxed out of retirement to fight one final bout -- 30 years after their last match.
keywords: [u'trainer', u'retirement', u'promoter', u'training', u'broke', u'boxer', u'two-word-title', u'no-opening-credits', u'reference-to-muhammad-ali', u'latex-gloves', u'prostate-exam', u'blue-screen', u'illegitimate-child', u'senior-citizen', u'sextegenarian', u'male-nurse', u'retirement-home', u'digital-prostate-exam', u'proctologist', u'punching-bag', u'reference-to-marv-albert', u'birds-eye-shot', u'junkyard', u'dartboard', u'reference-to-jack-johnson', u'reference-to-joe-frazier', u'reference-to-jack-dempsey', u'reference-to-joe-louis', u'reference-to-the-kardashians', u'media-event', u'press-conference', u'gym', u'father-son-reunion', u'diner', u'reference-to-george-foreman', u'car-dealer', u'scrapbook', u'football-coach', u'money', u'ring', u'italian', u'rivalry', u'rematch', u'dishonesty']
taglines: [u'De Niro -vs- Stallone', u'A rivalry 30 years in the making.', u'When time hits hard, hit harder.', u'No matter how old you are, come out swinging.', u'A battle of the ages.', u'Never give up the fight.']
trivia: [u'Most people think this film was a Sylvester Stallone project, but according to Robert De Niro he got the script first and quickly came to the conclusion that Stallone would be the best choice to play his opponent. Stallone himself was actually quite reluctant to do the film at first, as he did not want to parody Rocky (1976) and De Niro had to talk him into it. Stallone claimed that he had a harder than usual time training for the role since he was taking a break from action roles and had stopped working out as much as he normally does.', u'Alternate endings were filmed to avoid any spoilers or leaks.', u'Sally Rose is played by Kim Basinger in the 2010s scenes and her daughter Ireland Baldwin in the 1980s scenes.', u"During Kid's training a Rocky (1976) picture is seen on the wall.", u"In a scene, while training, Razor is about to punch hanging raw meat in a meat locker and is told not to by Lightning because it is unsanitary. This is a nod to the Rocky scene where he does break the ribs and obviously doesn't care if it is unsanitary.", u"In one scene Razor trains at an auto junk yard, through towing a semi-truck named Road Hawk. This is a homage to Sylvester Stallone's character Lincoln Hawk from Over the Top (1987).", u'This film reunites Sylvester Stallone and Robert De Niro for first time since Cop Land (1997).', u"This is Ireland Baldwin's feature film debut.", u'In the mid-credits scene, on the wall of Dante\'s office is a fight poster that reads,"Segal Vs Ewing". This is a reference to the film producers Peter Segal and Michael Ewing. The same poster reads "Osbrink vs King" in a reference to the talent scouts/promoters Cindy Osbrink (Hollywood) and Don King (boxing), as well as "Gerber vs Mehta" referring to the film\'s producers Bill Gerber and Ravi D. Mehta .', u'The film can boast three Oscar winners, Robert De Niro, Kim Basinger and Alan Arkin, as well as one nominee, Sylvester Stallone.', u"It has been 33 years since Robert De Niro last stepped into the ring for his Oscar-winning role as Jake La Motta in Martin Scorsese's Raging Bull (1980).", u'Both Robert De Niro and Sylvester Stallone have portrayed boxers in previous films. Stallone in the Rocky saga, and De Niro in Raging Bull (1980). Both have also been nominated for Oscars (Best Actor in a Leading Role) with only De Niro winning.', u"Grossed only seven million dollars in its opening weekend, placing it at number eleven in that week's box-office charts, a considerable disappointment for all concerned.", u'Robert De Niro was 70 years old at the time of filming while Sylvester Stallone was 67.', u'In-between takes Sadarias Harrell could be seen writing possible songs for his debut LP. When he ran out of paper, he wrote on the money in his pocket.', u'Kevin Hart and Sylvester Stallone share the birthday of July 6.', u'John Bernthal, (B.J.), was born the same year Rocky (1976) was released, and Kevin Hart, (Dante Slate Jr.), was born the same year Rocky II (1979) was released.', u'Although Rich Little is billed as simply boxing announcer, he is clearly imitating iconic sportscaster Howard Cosell and his famous "Down goes Frazier!" call from the Joe Frazier-George Foreman fight.', u'Sylvester Stallone received a record 14th Golden Raspberry Award nomination for his performance in this, Bullet to the Head (2012) and Escape Plan (2013). He lost out to Jaden Smith for After Earth (2013).', u'The ultimate winner of the Grudge Match is Razor, probably due to the fact that Rocky (1976) has an arguably larger following than Raging Bull (1980). Stallone was nominated for a Best Actor Oscar for his performance in Rocky (1976) while De Niro won his Best Actor Oscar for his performance in Raging Bull (1980).']
