taglines: [u'And you thought your parents were embarrassing.', u'Misery loves family.']
trivia: [u'The MPAA would not allow the movie to use the title unless they found an actual family with the name "Focker."', u"Alanna Ubach, who played Greg's former nanny, Isabelle, is actually ten years younger than Ben Stiller.", u'James Brolin was originally approached for the role of Bernie, but turned it down. When director Jay Roach went to approach Dustin Hoffman for the role, Hoffman was talking non-stop and even out of the point,which made him the instant choice for Bernie.', u'Teri Polo accidentally called Barbra Streisand "Boob," which ended up becoming her on-set nickname.', u'The flight attendant, Kali Rocha, is the same actress from Meet the Parents (2000). That is why Greg gives her an odd look when she offers to take his bag and be helpful.', u'Dustin Hoffman says he has heard that Robert De Niro is a "Tom Collins" man. Tom Collins is the alias De Niro\'s character used at the bank in Casino (1995).', u'The horn on the Byrnes\' RV plays the tune of "Puff the Magic Dragon," about which Greg and Jack had a conversation in Meet the Parents (2000).', u'The motion picture association would not allow the name "Fockers" to be on posters or part of the main title for the movie, unless the filmmakers could prove somewhere in America that there was in fact someone with the real last name "Focker." Apparently, they found somebody because the movie was granted the name "Meet the Fockers" by the MPAA.', u'Spencer and Bradley Pickren, who both play Little Jack Byrnes, both know sign language and have both been in a series of videos, "Signing Time!"', u'During production, the proposed title of "Meet the Fockers" was thought by the studio to be too vulgar. The spelling was briefly changed to "Meet the Fokkers," but that would have upset the franchise\'s continuity, so it was changed back.', u"Greg's full name is Gaylord Myron Focker.", u'The actors portraying Greg Focker\'s parents and in-laws have won a combined six Academy Awards. Dustin Hoffman (Bernie Focker) won two Oscars for Best Actor for Kramer vs. Kramer (1979) and Rain Man (1988). Barbra Streisand (Roz Focker) won one Oscar for Best Actress for Funny Girl (1968) and one Oscar for Best Original Song for "Evergreen," from the film A Star Is Born (1976). Robert De Niro won an Oscar for Best Supporting Actor for The Godfather Part II (1974) and another Oscar for Best Actor for Raging Bull (1980).', u'The close-up of Bernie Focker\'s license plate, as he and Greg are driving away, reveals the letters "TMI," a subtle reference to Bernie\'s propensity for overly detailed explanations and descriptions of personal information. "TMI" is the literary abbreviation for "Too Much Information."', u'The rum bottle that the Fockers have in their house is Mount Gay Rum.', u"When the first film and this sequel - while hugely successful - failed to raise Teri Polo's profile as an actress, she posed for a Playboy spread the following year.", u'The opening scene (outside the hospital) is the same as in Meet the Parents (2000).', u'The highest grossing film that Robert De Niro has ever appeared in.', u'Jack (Robert De Niro) says that Greg\'s "son" looks like a young Latino Marlon Brando. De Niro and Brando both played the role of Don Vito Corleone in "The Godfather" franchise (1972-1990); Brando played the older version in The Godfather (1972) and De Niro played the younger version in The Godfather: Part II (1974).', u"Robert De Niro spent a lot of time when he wasn't filming hanging out with the twins who play his grandson. He felt it important to bond with the twins as much as possible to make his onscreen relationship with them credible.", u"Barbra Streisand found making the film to be a refreshing experience as it was her first time as just a jobbing actress in 23 years. Normally, she's involved in her films more heavily, either as a producer, writer or director.", u'When visiting the Focker household, Pam is seen looking at a vinyl record. The album is "Make It Big," released by Wham! in 1984.', u"Barbra Streisand modeled her hair on Dustin Hoffman's wife.", u'The Judge also played a judge in Boston Legal.', u"Dustin Hoffman and Robert De Niro had previously worked together on Barry Levinson's Wag the Dog (1997).", u'Although set in Florida, the entire film was shot in Los Angeles.', u'Roz (Streisand) gives Jack a massage where he lies shirtless on a massage table and she rubs his back and then runs her hands down under his belly. After doing that a few times, she says, "Oops, hit some driftwood" (an erection joke). Coincidence is, Barbra Streisand acted in Maurice Tei Dunn\'s play, Driftwood, in New York in 1959.', u'Baby LJ says "Ass...hole" nine times, the most said from a minor in a Dreamworks film.', u"Jack lets Greg drive the RV for part of the road trip from New York to Florida. It later gets damaged by Bernie (Greg's father), then repaired by Jorge (initially thought to be Greg's son)."]

title: Shark Tale
plot_outline: When a son of a gangster shark boss is accidentally killed while on the hunt, his would-be prey and his vegetarian brother both decide to use the incident to their own advantage.
keywords: [u'fish', u'shark', u'anchor', u'vegetarian', u'mobster', u'animal-protagonist', u'f-rated', u'cgi-animation', u'puffer-fish', u'anthropomorphic-animal', u'anthropomorphism', u'two-word-title', u'fish-in-title', u'animal-in-title', u'shark-feature', u'benny-hill-theme-tune', u'seal-the-animal', u'title-directed-by-female', u'family-relationships', u'seahorse', u'cult-film', u'faked-death', u'daydream', u'unrequited-love', u'traffic-jam', u'torture', u'sushi-bar', u'secret', u'romantic-rivalry', u'record-player', u'receptionist', u'ransom', u'pawnshop', u'oyster', u'lie', u'elementary-school', u'electric-shock', u'death-of-brother', u'crab', u'bondage', u'best-friend', u'accidental-death', u'cgi-film', u'blockbuster', u'worm', u'whale', u'urban-setting', u'studio-logo-segues-into-film', u'shrimp', u'shipwreck', u'scene-during-end-credits', u'reggae', u'racetrack', u'pearl', u'party', u'organized-crime', u'office-romance', u'north-atlantic', u'necklace', u'mob-hit', u'loss-of-son', u'loss-of-brother', u'lava-lamp', u'kidnapping', u'interview', u'hip-hop', u'funeral', u'flashback', u'femme-fatale', u'father-son-relationship', u'fainting', u'disguise', u'debt', u'crime-boss', u'chase', u'celebrity', u'car-wash', u'brother-brother-relationship', u'x-rayed-skeleton', u'octopus', u'underwater', u'restaurant', u'jellyfish', u'friendship', u'farce', u'computer-animation', u'mafia-don']
taglines: [u"A New School's Gonna Rule.", u'In fall, a new school will rule.', u'The story of what happens when one little fish tells a great white lie...', u'Behind every little fish is a great white lie.', u"A new school's gonna rule..."]
trivia: [u'The original title for the movie was "Sharkslayer," but it was changed to "Shark Tale" about a year before release, because Jeffrey Katzenberg thought the title might scare families away (the title still appears in some early promotional material). The change is clear in the movie, as in the song before the credits, the singers interlock between calling the movie "Sharkslayer" and "Shark Tale."', u"When Don Lino is clearly seen for the first time (when he looks up from the aquarium), a mole can be seen near his right eye, a distinct facial feature of Lino's voice actor, Robert De Niro.", u'According to Hans Zimmer, he told producer Jeffrey Katzenberg that he could not deal with any more epic films, but wanted to do a fun animated movie instead, and so he got the chance to compose for this film.', u'A sequel had been discussed, but it was never produced.', u'During the end credits, Crazy Joe, the hermit crab, taps on Head of Artistic Development Frank Gladstone\'s name and yells out, "What! You see this guy? He hardly worked on the movie at all! Always on the phone yakking yakking yakking..."', u'Ernie the Jellyfish (Ziggy Marley) sings the song "Three Little Birds," a song written by Ziggy\'s father, Bob Marley, with the small difference of Ziggy changing "birds" to "fishes" in keeping with the film\'s aquatic theme.', u'When Oscar goes to the time clock, there is a note on the wall saying, "If you don\'t come in Saturday, don\'t bother..." This is a reference to a famous memo Jeffrey Katzenberg sent to execs while he was with Disney.', u'Some of the actors, most notably Robert De Niro and Martin Scorsese, Will Smith and Jack Black, and Smith and Ren\xe9e Zellweger, recorded their lines together.', u'Some of the "fishified" products are: "Coral Cola" (Coca-Cola), "Gup" (GAP), "Fish King" (Burger King), "Old Wavy" (Old Navy), and "Newsreef" (Newsweek).', u'LOGO GIMMICK: The fisher boy in the moon throws his line (worm attached) into the ocean, where the worm encounters Lenny.', u'In the racetrack sequence, there are more than 16,000 computer animated 3-D characters in the stands.', u'The plot has some resemblance to "The Reluctant Dragon," a short story from 1897 written by Kenneth Grahame.', u'Classifying the characters in terms of species, Oscar is a bluestreak cleaner wrasse (which explains his whale-cleaning status), Angie is a marine angelfish, Sykes is a porcupinefish, Lola is a lionfish, Don Feiberg is a leopard shark, and Crazy Joe is a hermit crab.', u"The Castilian Spanish dubbing of Shark Tale (2004) is considered by the Spanish audience to be one of the worst dubbing ever made in Spain. In that time, the Spanish television show Naapureina Madridissa (2003), was a big hit. So, the distributors decided to used some of the actors from that show (some of them with no dubbing experience) to do the voices of some characters. Fernando Tejero dubbed Oscar, Mar\xeda Ad\xe1nez dubbed Angie, and Santiago Ramos dubbed Sykes. Also, actors (not from the original show) Jos\xe9 Sancho and Natalia Verbeke, were in the cast as Don Lino and Lola, and also television journalist and host Mercedes Mil\xe1 as Katie Current. The audience criticized the most Tejero's performance as Oscar. This happened again a couple of years later with Over the Hedge (2006).", u"Anthony Anderson was cast as a sperm whale, but the role's suggestive dialogue got his character cut down. Anderson had only a few non-risqu\xe9 lines--when the whale meets Angie and when Oscar cleans the whale's eye.", u"There are nods throughout the movie that sharks' den is the wreck of the Titanic. However, the outside and interiors of the shipwreck are based on the S.S. Normandie, a French ocean liner of the 1930s. Particular examples are, the scenes at the bar, when Lino and Sykes meet for the first time, and the dining room, where the sitting is set.", u'The American Family Association, a Christian conservative organization, raised concerns about Shark Tale (2004), suggesting that it was designed to promote the acceptance of gay rights by children. Primarily, by having Lenny the Shark who is a vegetarian shark, and his struggles as an allegory for the struggles gay men go through with their homosexuality.', u'Don Lino (voiced by Robert De Niro) tells Sykes (voiced by Martin Scorsese) that they have worked together for a long time. In reality, Martin Scorsese and Robert De Niro have actually worked together multiple times since the 1970s, most notably in Taxi Driver (1976), Raging Bull (1980), Goodfellas (1990), and Casino (1995).', u'In the scene where Sykes is fired, he is thrown against the drawing of Rose that Jack drew in Titanic (1997).', u"This was Will Smith's first animated theatrical film.", u'This was the ninth highest-grossing film of 2004.', u'The second DreamWorks Animation film that does not feature humans, after Antz (1998).', u"In the film's early stages of production, James Gandolfini was considered for the voice of Don Lino, Christopher Walken was considered for the voice of Luca the Octopus, and Sacha Baron Cohen was considered for one of the Jellyfish. Cohen would later go on to voice King Julian the Lemur in the Madagascar films, also by Dreamworks Animation.", u"The shark gangster voiced by Peter Falk was originally called Don Brizzi. Bowing to pressure from the Italic Institute of America, an organization protesting Hollywood's stereotyping of Italians as mobsters and gangsters, DreamWorks agreed to change the name of the character to Don Feinberg just before release.", u"The Anti-Italian Defamation League protested the film's release, and even after the changes to appeal to them, disowned the film.", u'Only Dreamworks Animation Film where the Cast Names of Major Characters in the film are listed at both the start and the end outside the credit crawl (though the end features 6 other cast members than at the start). Other Dreamworks Animation Films either have it being shown the latter way or the former way.', u'After Oscar (Will Smith) "defeats" Lenny (Jack Black) in their staged fight, the crowd starts chanting, "Oscar, boma ye!" Smith was nominated for an Oscar for his portrayal of Muhammad Ali in Ali (2001). The climax of the film depicts the legendary "Rumble in the Jungle" match against George Foreman, including the crowd\'s famous chant of "Ali, boma ye."', u'For Australian audiences, Katie Current is voiced by renowned Australian channel 9 news anchor Tracy Grimshaw.', u"Jack Black's 2nd Animated Film, after Ice Age (2002).", u'During the staged fight scene between Oscar and Lenny, Lenny accidentally catches Oscar in his mouth. Oscar slowly opens Lenny\'s mouth to demonstrate his strength. After doing so, he spouts off a few famous movie lines, one being, "You had me at hello." This line is a reference to the film Jerry Maguire (1996), and it was spoken by Ren\xe8e Zellwegger, who was the voice of Angie in this movie. In the film, Angie has a very subtle reaction to this line in particular, a small nod to her former role.', u"In this film, Oscar is voiced by Will Smith. His wife Jada Pinkett Smith would later go onto voice Gloria the Hippo in Dreamworks Animation's Madagascar Trilogy.", u'Doug E. Doug and Katie Couric share the same birthday, January 7th.', u'The reporting newsfish is named Katie Current, whose name is a nod to U.S. newscaster Katie Couric, who voiced the character.', u'This film received negative reception for the reasons that the characters in the movie looked so much like their voice actors, there were jokes that made no sense and there was a mean spirited environment, Oscar was being a complete jerk towards most characters in the film and had acted like a bad person in general, there were a lot of ignorant attempts at comedy, and Dreamworks made this film dark, due to some characters dying on-screen, and using that as dark comedy that frightens younger audiences.', u'This was the first DreamWorks Animation movie with a new logo to have a logo gimmick.', u"The behind-the-scenes reveal Don Lino's first name as Edward.", u'While Lenny is a self-confessed vegetarian, he eats his best friends, Oscar and Angie (although temporarily).', u'With Lola forming an alliance with the Sharks during the Climax to get revenge for being dumped as part of her more tougher side, this makes her the first character in a Dreamworks Animation film to be a Hidden Secondary Antagonist.', u'The 2nd Dreamworks Animation film to have the Main Antagonist redeem towards the end, the first film like that being Sinbad: Legend of the Seven Seas (2003).']

title: Godsend
plot_outline: A couple agree to have their deceased son cloned, under the supervision of an enigmatic doctor but bizarre things start to happen years after his rebirth.
keywords: [u'birthday', u'boy', u'doctor', u'cloning', u'clone', u'steel-ball', u'operating-room', u'school-laboratory', u'science-teacher', u'bicycle', u'spit-in-face', u'stegosaurus', u'topless-woman', u'paranoia', u'bathtub', u'science-runs-amok', u'psycho-thriller', u'lost-child', u'genetic-engineering', u'experiment-gone-wrong', u'doctor-patient-relationship', u'children', u'shoes', u'shed', u'school', u'photography', u'hammer', u'funeral', u'fire', u'dream', u'dead-child', u'darkroom', u'church', u'chain', u'blood', u'attempted-child-murder', u'nightmare', u'death-of-child']
taglines: [u'Adam Duncan. Born: December 11, 1987. Died: December 12, 1995. Born September 23, 1996.', u'When a miracle becomes a nightmare, evil is born.', u'Their dreams came true...their nightmares will too.', u'Evil is here.', u'On April 30th, evil is born.', u'Scare as Hell!', u'If someone you love was taken from you, how far would you go to bring him back from the dead?']
trivia: [u'Robert De Niro had originally planned on merely providing a brief cameo for the film - however after director Nick Hamm heard De Niro would be interested in his project, he asked De Niro to participate in a few more scenes that were all filmed within a week. De Niro later regretted this because his name was "splashed over all the advertisements".', u'Before the release of this movie, Lions Gate Films set up two official websites: one conventional site with movie information, and one site that appeared to be a promotional tool for the (fictional) cloning institute depicted in the movie. The website gave an email address and phone number (1-888-699-2672) for the "Godsend Institute;" calling the number resulted in a recorded message giving the institute\'s office hours. Several news outlets reported that when a few bereaved parents called or emailed the fake institute to inquire about having their children genetically reconstituted, the studio started responding to them and explaining that it was just a movie tie-in and not a real laboratory. Similar advertisements for fictional medical procedures and clinics were also produced as parts of the advertising campaigns for Gattaca (1997) and Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind (2004).', u'Five different endings were shot for this movie and the released one is the tamest one.', u'The operating room sequences were filmed inside the empty swimming pool of the institute complex.', u'The snow scene in the graveyard was unplanned. It was hoped the snow would remain until the scene was completed, and it was.']

trivia: [u'Final film of Joe Viterelli.', u'The Mercedes that chases Paul and Ben had to be modified for filming, since that brand of car does not swerve very well in high-speed pursuits.', u'When Robert De Niro is singing "I Feel Pretty", one word was change in the Lyrics. In the part "I feel pretty and witty and gay" the word "gay" was changed by "bright".', u'Leo Rossi was initially meant to reprise his role of Carlo Mangano.', u'Paul\'s main nemesis is named Ragazzi, which in Italian means "boys".', u'The film reunites Robert De Niro with his Raging Bull (1980) co-star, Cathy Moriarty.', u'The dancer at the beginning was a last-minute replacement when the one who was originally cast never showed up.', u"Well known Albanian actor Luan Bexheti's picture is on the door to Anthony LaPaglia's trailer.", u"The film states that Paul Vitti (DeNiro) is at Sing Sing, but the scenes were filmed in Riker's Island in New York City.", u'At one point in the film, Robert De Niro asks Reg Rogers what his directing background is to which he answers, "theater mostly". In 3 episodes of the show Friends, Reg Rogers plays a theater director, and is a very similar character.', u'Joe Torre: New York Yankees manager, as himself in restaurant scene', u'When Robert De Niro\'s character Paul Vitti gets to reunite with his friends and tell them he\'s out of the mob business, one of them reminds him about some of his greatest crimes; he says, "Remember the strike on Air France? People is still talking about that!". This is a nod to De Niro\'s role as Jimmy Conway in Goodfellas (1990), in which Conway was part of a gang that stole millions from an Air France terminal.', u'When Dr. Sobel discovers that his son is working for Paul Vitti as his driver, at one point he yells at him "Move out, Clemenza!". This is a nod to "The Godfather" movies, especially the second one, in which Robert De Niro plays a young Vito Corleone and meets with a young Clemenza and become friends.', u"During the sequence where Dr. Sobel (Billy Crystal) tests Paul Vitti's (Robert De Niro) catatonic state, he makes a lot of noises and gestures to make Paul laugh in order to expose his catatonia as fake, which of course never happens. De Niro stated in an interview that it was really difficult for him to stay emotionless while Crystal was doing all those funny faces and sounds."]

title: City by the Sea
plot_outline: Vincent Lamarca, whose father was executed for a 1950s kidnapping of a child, grew up to become a police officer, only to see his own son become a murderer.
keywords: [u'beach', u'murder', u'new-york-city', u'grandson', u'police', u'cartoon-on-tv', u'world-trade-center', u'reference-to-chuck-berry', u'family-abandonment', u'thug', u'police-officer-killed', u'on-the-run', u'taxi', u'rain', u'money', u'key', u'helicopter', u'guitar', u'ambulance', u'based-on-article', u'father-son-relationship', u'based-on-true-story', u'independent-film', u'title-spoken-by-character']
taglines: [u"When you're searching for a killer... the last suspect you want to see is your son."]
trivia: [u'Robert De Niro personally had James Franco cast, after viewing his performance in James Dean (2001).', u'Michael Caton-Jones was unhappy with the final result and said that working on this film for 3 years was the worst and most depressing period of his career.', u'One of two films in 2002, in which Robert De Niro appeared with his daughter Drena De Niro. The other is Showtime (2002).', u'In his autobiography Dream Repairman, editor Jim Clark wrote that he walked out of the post-production in mid-2001 with the film shown in Cannes incomplete with missing insert footage. Clark said that "My 70th birthday was coming up on May 24 and I wanted to be home for that. Also, I was tired of sitting in small airless rooms in New York waiting for something to happen on a film that seemed mired in inaction."', u'Robert De Niro and William Forsythe previously appeared together in Once Upon a Time in America (1984).', u'In June 2001, Michael Caton-Jones and his assistant Mitchel Stanley were ordered to move to Los Angeles to finish the film thus missing the 9/11 terrorist attacks that could also hit the editing facility in Tribeca.', u'Both Robert De Niro (Vincent LaMarca) and William Forsythe (Spyder) have played Al Capone on screen. De Niro in The Untouchables (1987) movie, and Forsythe in The Untouchables (1993) TV show.', u"James Franco appeared with Tobey Maguire in Spider-Man the same year. Maguire previously had a small role in This Boy's Life, which starred Robert De Niro.", u"The character of Bree, played by Stephi Lineburg, is named after the director's younger sister.", u'George Dzundza and Robert De Niro previously appeared in The Deer Hunter (1978) together.', u'Al Pacino was approached for the lead role.']

trivia: [u'Rene Russo\'s assistant "Annie" is portrayed by Robert De Niro\'s real life adopted daughter Drena De Niro.', u'William Shatner is teaching Trey how to test the cocaine, when in fact Eddie Murphy tested out cocaine the same way in Beverly Hills Cop (1984).', u'While filming Mitch and Trey doing promos for Showtime, William Shatner complains that Mitch "is the worst actor I\'ve ever seen". In the beginning the film, Mitch goes on an undercover sting with another cop. That was Mitch's partner. He was wounded during the shootout with Lazy Boy. taglines: [u'There are no partners in crime']
trivia: [u"This was Marlon Brando's final, completed film.", u'Marlon Brando took to calling director Frank Oz "Fozzy" and "Miss Piggy" during this movie. Oz is the voice of the Fozzy Bear and Miss Piggy characters in The Muppets. Brando\'s hazing of Oz over his work with the Muppets got so bad that Robert De Niro was forced to direct Brando instead, with Oz giving him instructions via headset.', u'Marlon Brando refused to smile in his last scene in this movie, so his ever-so-slight smile was added in post-production by a computer.', u'This is the only movie to star both Robert De Niro and Marlon Brando, the first actors ever to both win Academy Awards for playing the same role, that of Vito Corleone in the The Godfather (1972) and The Godfather: Part II (1974).', u'Edward Norton later stated in interviews that he did this movie solely to have his name on the same poster with Robert De Niro and Marlon Brando.', u'During breaks, Marlon Brando would walk around the set naked because of the warm weather where the film was being shot.', u'Robert De Niro was reportedly the victim of several practical jokes pulled by Marlon Brando during filming, including a remote controlled electronic whoopee cushion.', u'The first scene with Marlon Brando and Robert De Niro talking at a table was shot with De Niro on a tight schedule, giving the filmmakers only thirty minutes to set up the cameras and lighting.', u'Most of the tools techniques and tactics used in this movie were authentic and functional. They were suggested or provided by technical advisor Mick Gould.', u"When fighting in Jackie's apartment, Burt is shown slamming Jackie's face into the kitchen counter twice. This part was filmed with him doing it only once; the second slam was created with precise editing.", u"In Jackie's final scenes, he is wearing a Baltimore Orioles cap. Edward Norton is from the Baltimore suburb of Columbia, and he is an avid Orioles fan; he took batting practice with the team to help publicize this movie's premiere in July 2001.", u'Edward Norton scripted the "talent in the choices" scene between Nick and Jackie.', u'Many of the scenes inside the Montreal Customs House were filmed inside the actual building. The filmmakers built some temporary additions and used some CGI to suit their purposes. For instance, there is no elevator that goes down from the ground floor to the basement.', u'Michael Douglas was originally attached to star as Nick Wells.', u'Ben Affleck was offered the role of Jackie, but he turned it down.', u'The thermic lance used on the safe is a real cutting tool. Pressurized oxygen is pumped through an iron tube full of iron rods. An oxyacetylene torch is used to heat and ignite the open end, creating a stream of burning iron. Producing a temperature of around 4,500 degrees C, a thermic lance can burn rapidly through concrete and steel.', u'The film cast includes two Oscar winners: Robert De Niro and Marlon Brando; and two Oscar nominees: Edward Norton and Angela Bassett.', u"The scene where Robert De Niro accepts Marlon Brando's offer, but only for more money so he can retire, is reminiscent of a scene in Midnight Run (1988) where De Niro accepts Joe Pantoliano's offer but only for more money so he can retire.", u'The huge red ship in one shot is Orsula, a bulk carrier. It was built at at Jiangnan Shipyard, Shanghai, in 1996. Filmmakers had not planned to include Orsula in the background, but it spontaneously added production value.', u'Jamie Harrold brags that he can do anything if he is given only a KayPro 64 computer and a dial tone. There was the KayPro II, a large portable machine with a small green screen, and there was the Commodore 64, a home computer which displayed on your TV, but no KayPro 6.', u'On December 15, 2011, Orsula went aground on the St. Lawrence River near Becancour, Quebec, Canada, not far from its appearance in the film. The incident was caused by loss of control due to rudder failure, and resulted in no injuries, pollution release, or property damage. Orsula itself was not heavily damaged.', u'The computer codes relayed to the hacker are: 317 946 5839.', u'Marlon Brando previously appeared in Bedtime Story (1964), which was remade by director Frank Oz as Dirty Rotten Scoundrels (1988).', u"The filmmakers debated whether or not Jackie should kill Danny when he stumbles upon his scheme in the basement; ultimately they decided that Danny's kindness toward Jackie's fake alter ego Brian justified sparing his life.", u'Episode 59 of the television show MythBusters (2003) put the myth of breaking into a safe the way Nick did to the test. Using a thermal lance like Nick, they were able to burn a hole into the same model safe, but it took a very long time and several thermal rods. The contents of the Mythbusters\' safe were burned as well. The safe was not watertight so they had to seal it from the outside before filling it with water. However, the underwater explosion did blow the door off before the glass relocker mechanism could engage. Based on the safe door becoming dislodged and past police reports they determined it was "plausible".', u'It was director of photography Rob Hahn\'s idea to have Nick taunt Jack with Brian\'s line "Okay, bye-bye" after tricking him at the end.', u'Edward Norton previously played a character who feigned an alter ego in Primal Fear (1996). In both films, his alter ego has some kind of speech impediment.']

taglines: [u'America likes to watch', u"The killings won't stop until you stop watching.", u'"In the future, everyone will be famous for 15 minutes." - Andy Warhol, 1967', u'Why are you still watching?', u"America's had enough", u"Some people will kill for their...15 MINUTES. Now, two of New York's finest must stop the madness."]
trivia: [u'The scene in the bathroom, where Robert De Niro dunks his head in a sink full of ice, is in fact a real trick that real police detectives use to get over hangovers. De Niro discovered the trick during his research for the role, and was eventually written in.', u'Charlize Theron appeared for free, as a "thank you" to John Herzfeld for giving her the breakthrough role in 2 Days in the Valley (1996).', u'The immigration officer at the beginning of the movie is a real immigration officer, not an actor.', u'The language spoken by Charlize Theron\'s character is Afrikaans, one of the official languages of South Africa. She says, "Hello Mr. Botha, can I call you back? You would never believe who just walked in here, it\'s Eddie Flemming. Thank you, good-bye." Botha was a famous boxer in the 90s from South Africa. Charlize was born in South Africa, and speaks fluent Afrikaans.', u'Edward Burns gained twenty pounds, to accurately play an Arson Investigator, as they have to have spent at least seven years in the fire service, and would gain muscle mass across their backs, chests, and arms.', u'Graham Knuttel, the Dublin-born artist, was paid 50,000 pounds for a canvas which was destroyed in the film. The producers wanted the movie to be as realistic as possible, and so ordered the artwork to be destroyed in one scene.', u'The character of Eddie Fleming is based on former NYPD Detective Mike Sheehan, the investigating officer in The Preppie Murder (1989), which John Herzfeld also directed.', u'Oleg Taktarov (Oleg) filmed everything that his character filmed with a consumer quality video camera.', u"Mindy Marin, who's the film's Casting Director, was featured in the part of Kim Cattrall's assistant, because she looked the part, and they weren't able to find an actress who was capable of playing the role prior to shooting, according to director John Herzfeld.", u'There are a lot of location inconsistencies throughout the film. Like the scene involving the apprehension of the Jamaican killer that Robert De Niro and Avery Brooks are going after early in the film, was clearly Los Angeles, and most of the scenes in Times Square, were shot in New York City, for example. Most of the interiors were shot on sound stages and actual New York City and Los Angeles locations.', u"While the film was delayed, J. Peter Robinson was brought on to provide a new beefed up original score for the film as the studio was not happy with what Anthony Marinelli had done musically for the film at that point. Marinelli had written about seventy minutes of music for the film. Robinson composed approximately thirty minutes of new material, and retained about half of Marinelli's contribution, which is why they share composing credit in the final credits for the film.", u'The tension between Emil and Oleg is based on the real tension between some Czechs and Russians. Many Czechs hate the Russian language, as they were forced to learn Russian under Soviet occupation. Karel Roden refused to speak Russian to Oleg Taktarov during rehearsals.', u'The film was originally slated to be released in the spring of 2000 by New Line Cinema, with theatrical trailers appearing in fall and winter 1999. For reasons unknown, the film was pulled from the spring 2000 schedule, and then delayed. The film was finally released in March of 2001. A similar situation would happen with Knockaround Guys (2001), which was slated to be released that spring, only to be yanked and delayed. That film would finally be released in late 2002.', u'The title comes from the famous quote by Andy Warhol who said, "In the future everyone will be famous for fifteen minutes".', u'To prepare him for filming, John Herzfeld told Oleg Taktarov to watch On the Waterfront (1954), Spartacus (1960), East of Eden (1955), The Third Man (1949), and Moby Dick (1956).', u'Robert De Niro ran the foot chase scene himself without a stunt double, in sweltering 100+ degree summer heat.', u'Jordy Warsaw (Edward Burns) appears fifteen minutes into the film.', u'Edward Burns plays the role of an Arson Investigator, which his co-star Robert De Niro played in Backdraft (1991).']

title: Meet the Parents
plot_outline: Male nurse Greg Focker meets his girlfriend's parents before proposing, but her suspicious father is every date's worst nightmare.

taglines: [u'First comes love. Then comes the interrogation.', u'No pressure.', u"He finally met the girl of his dreams. Too bad her dad's a nightmare."]
trivia: [u'The MPAA would not allow the name "Focker" unless the filmmakers could find an actual person with that surname.', u'Robert De Niro wanted "Mr. Jinx" to appear in more scenes than he was supposed to because De Niro liked the cat so much. Apparently, De Niro would also play with the cat between filming scenes.', u'At one time, Jim Carrey was slated to star as the lead and even contributed jokes to the screenplay, such as the main character being named "Focker."', u'The role of Pam Byrnes was initially given to Naomi Watts. She ultimately lost the role to Teri Polo because the filmmakers did not think she was "sexy" enough.', u'Christopher Walken was the second choice to play Jack Byrnes.', u"This is the only film in the series in which Pam's sister, Deborah Byrnes, appears onscreen, though she is frequently mentioned in all of the films. Nicole DeHuff, the actress who played her, died in 2005.", u'Jack\'s Thai is extremely poor and he is constantly repeating the word "what," making it seem like it is a longer conversation than it is. Thais applauded Robert De Niro\'s effort, however.', u'According to the DVD commentary, the car chase scene was originally meant to be a spoof of Ronin (1998). When the filmmakers got to the location, they saw how quickly the lights changed, realized it would be a funnier joke, and rewrote the scene (the lights really did change from green to red as fast as they are shown in the movie).', u"Greg's MCAT scores are (out of 15): 14 Verbal reasoning, 13 Physical Sciences, 15 Biological Sciences, and an R on the Writing Sample (very high).", u'According to Teri Polo, in the scene where she and Ben Stiller are making out on her bed and he fondles her breast, she stuffed cookies into her bra as a gag.', u'Anthony Hopkins was considered for the role of Jack Byrnes.', u"Pam calls Gaylord's parents in Detroit, Michigan. However, in the sequel, they live in Florida. When the Byrnes first arrive to the Fockers' home in the sequel, Greg's dad states that they moved from Detroit.", u"When Jack first questions Greg about the circle of trust, he says that nineteen months in a Vietnamese prison made him a patient man. This is a reference to The Deer Hunter (1978), where Robert De Niro's character spends time in a Vietnamese POW (prisoner of war) prison.", u'The home video footage of Teri Polo during the opening credits was filmed by her ex-husband Anthony Moore.', u'Writer Jerry Stahl, whom Ben Stiller portrayed in Permanent Midnight (1998), co-wrote the "cat milking" scene in this movie.', u'Owen Wilson brought a lot of his own ideas to the film and improvised many of his lines.', u'When Greg says grace at the dinner table. It is actually the song "Day By Day", from the award winning musical Godspell.', u'Julia Stiles auditioned for the part of Pam, but dropped out due to filming 10 Things I Hate About You (1999).', u'Ben Stiller flew out to Los Angeles to propose to Christine Taylor while shooting the film. She thought he was still in New York, and he surprised her at home with a path of candles and rose petals.', u'The film inspired a cat toilet-training product called "Litter Kwitter," which sold over 750,000 units.', u"Mr. Jinx is a Himalayan cat, a difficult breed to train. The trainers begged Jay Roach to choose another kind of cat, but he really liked the Himalayan's look.", u'Ben Stiller hated his clothes in the film. Director Jay Roach said it was all part of the plan to keep Stiller as uncomfortable as Greg.', u"John Hamburg, Ben Stiller's preferred screenwriter, did an uncredited rewrite during production.", u'Alexander Payne and Jim Taylor did an uncredited last script draft before shooting.', u'Robert De Niro took this role as part of his new focus on comedy. He had previously just done Analyze This (1999).', u'Director Jay Roach wanted the whole movie to feel like an "anxiety dream" for Greg.', u'Since cats are very temperamental, the filmmakers always had a back-up cat on set in case one would not cooperate.', u'The idea to use a lie detector test came from Robert De Niro while he was researching a role. He read up on polygraphs and presented his findings to director Jay Roach at a pre-shoot dinner. "At that point, there was no lie detector scene in the script," Roach told Entertainment Weekly. "But after hearing all this, I thought, \'Oh, this has to be in our movie.\' Now it\'s become the central image of all the ads, the trailers, everything." Jack Byrnes being ex-CIA was always part of his characters since the beginning, however.', u"Jack's knowledge of the NATO standard phonetic alphabet (Foxtrot, Oscar, Charlie, Kilo, Echo, Romeo, aka Focker) is all accurate.", u"It was Ben Stiller's idea to make Greg a male nurse.", u'Most of the movie was filmed without deciding how to say "Focker," so they had to go back and re-record it.', u"Writer Jim Herzfeld's influence for Greg was Benjamin Braddock in The Graduate (1967). Herzfeld used Benjamin to write a main character who was completely misunderstood.", u"Greg's airplane rant was cut from the version shown on planes.", u'The costume designer put Jack in soft sweaters to contrast the tough guy-type Robert De Niro usually plays.', u"When Ben Stiller came on board, the script was retooled. Originally, it had been written for Jim Carrey so it contained more physical, knockabout comedy. Stiller's style is less physical so this element in the script was rewritten.", u'Director Jay Roach was terrified to direct Meet the Parents (2000) and was nervous about attempting to sell the project to both Robert De Niro and Ben Stiller. Stiller thought Roach was only pretending to be nervous. Roach swears he was not. "I don\'t think it was strategy," Roach told Entertainment Weekly. "I wanted them to know I was terrified. I\'m really bad at faking."', u'Ever the Method actor, Robert De Niro chose to keep his distance from Ben Stiller during the shoot to help him maintain an aloofness between the two men.', u'The scenes at the "Surf and Turf" restaurant were filmed at a Port Washington, NY restaurant called "Louie\'s." The car racing scenes between Ben Stiller and Robert De Niro were also filmed in downtown Port Washington. Also, the scene where Stiller and De Niro go shopping is in Port Washington at Salem Drugs.', u"Westchester County Regional Airport in New York state was used to portray Chicago's O'Hare International Airport and New York City's LaGuardia Airport.", u'Teri Polo was cast for her sarcastic edge.', u'Meet the Parents (2000) is actually a remake of a 1992 Independent film of the same name. The 75 minute short film starred Greg Glienna and Mary Ruth Clarke, who also wrote the script. Glienna also directed on the film on a budget of about $100,000. Unable to find a distributor for their film, the filmmakers eventually sold the rights to Universal Studios.', u"Look closely and you'll see that the car chase scene is largely comprised of close-ups of Ben Stiller and Robert De Niro. The actors shot their scenes on separate nights.", u'Robert De Niro originally wanted to train the cat himself but then realized that would take up to about 6 months of his life. Instead, he would carry kibble in all his pockets which helped him enjoy a very co-operative relationship with the animal.', u'On July 18, 2005, a regularly scheduled American Airlines flight from Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport to San Juan, Puerto Rico was diverted back to Fort Lauderdale forty minutes into the flight, after a flight attendant found a crumpled napkin that read "Bomb, bomb, bomb...meet the parents." The airplane was met by a bomb squad of the local sheriff\'s office as well as the FBI, whose agents questioned the plane\'s 176 passengers about the note.', u'Christina Ricci was considered for the role of Pam Byrnes.', u'Steven Soderbergh was originally attached to direct.', u'Greg tells the stewardess on the plane to "shut your pie hole;" Robert De Niro said the same thing several times in This Boy\'s Life (1993).', u'Included among the "1,001 Movies You Must See Before You Die," edited by Steven Schneider.', u'The crew trained the cat in the movie to climb the side of the house, by calling it with a buzzer to get a treat.', u"The Victor Talbot's tuxedo store in the film is located in Greenvale, New York.", u'Production designers built the full interior of the house inside a giant armory in Brooklyn, New York. They wanted a "tasteful, Republican" feel, so the colors are red, white, and blue.', u'Earned back its initial budget of $55 million in just 11 days.', u'Although set in Chicago, none of the film was actually shot there.', u'Alexander Payne and Jim Taylor did an uncredited rewrite of the screenplay. The poem that Robert De Niro reads about his deceased mother was one of their contributions as was the climactic airport sequence.', u'Director Jay Roach tried to keep Ben Stiller off-balance by not letting him know if Robert De Niro liked his work.', u"The of original opening of Meet the Parents (2000) was too expensive to film. It featured Greg proposing to Pam during a Cubs game at Wrigley Field-and failing spectacularly. To save money (the film had a $55 million budget), they had Greg's failed proposal take place outside of a school instead.", u'Director Jay Roach said that they were not making a comedy, they were making "a broken love story."', u"At one point in the film's development, Steven Spielberg was set to direct.", u'The cat, "Mr. Jinx," was played by a cat named Mishka.', u'Remained in the US top 10 box office for 11 weeks.', u'The 7th highest grossing film of 2000.', u'In the first dinner scene when Jack asks Greg to say grace and Pam tells him that Greg is Jewish, Greg says, "It\'s not like I\'m a rabbi." In that same year, Ben Stiller played a rabbi in the film Keping the Faith (2000).', u"The burglary alarm system at Jack's house is of a Magnum Alert MA1000e type.", u'James Rebhorn and Tom McCarthy both also appeared in two espionage thrillers of 2009 that starred Clive Owen. Rebhorn was in The International (2009) and McCarthy was in Duplicity (2009).', u'Blythe Danner said her character was inspired by the famous comedienne Gracie Allen.', u'American Humane Association monitored the animal action. No animals were harmed. Scenes appearing to place animals in jeopardy were simulated. AHA200802-2', u'In the movie Jack\'s drink of choice is a Tom Collins. "Tom Collins" is also the alias de Niro\'s character in Casino, Sam Rothstein, uses to register his personal safe deposit box.', u"Eight years earlier, Ben Stiller parodied Robert De Niro's performance as Max Cady in Cape Fear (1991) on The Ben Stiller Show (1992).", u"Spencer Breslin: one of Pam's students.", u'When Greg is having his outburst on the plane, a man in the background to the left can be seen trying not to laugh.', u'In an early scene, Greg (Ben Stiller) and Jack (Robert De Niro) share differing opinions about the theme of the song "Puff the Magic Dragon." In the film\'s concluding scene, when Jack is watching Greg on his surveillance tapes, "Puff the Magic Dragon" is playing softly in the background.']

title: Men of Honor
plot_outline: The story of Carl Brashear, the first African-American, then also the first amputee, U.S. Navy Diver, and the man who trained him.
keywords: [u'navy', u'african-american', u'racism', u'amputee', u'racial-discrimination', u'u.s.-navy', u'u.s.-military', u'determination', u'training', u'master-chief', u'instructor', u'motivational', u'military', u'civil-rights', u'race-relations', u'racial-segregation', u'racial-prejudice', u'racial-tension', u'diving-suit', u'diving-helmet', u'three-word-title', u'1950s', u'u-boat', u'decompression-chamber', u'rescue', u'prejudice', u'institutional-discrimination', u'black-romance', u'submarine', u'courtroom', u'bigotry', u'alcohol', u'racial-slur', u'breakthrough-hero', u'hero', u'disabled', u'amputation', u'deep-sea-diving', u'disabled-person', u'based-on-true-story', u'marriage']
taglines: [u'History is made by those who break the rules.']
trivia: [u"Carl Brashear's great-nephew is NHL bruiser Donald Brashear of the New York Rangers.", u"In 2009, the USNS T-AKE 7 was named the USNS Carl Brashear, in honor of Master Chief Boatswain's Mate (Master Diver) Carl M. Brashear (1931-2006), who joined the U.S. Navy in 1948. He was one of the first African-Americans to graduate from the Navy Diving School, and was designated a Navy salvage diver. He was the first African-American to qualify and serve as a master diver while on active duty, and the first U.S. Navy diver to be restored to full active duty as an amputee, the result of a leg injury he sustained during a salvage operation. After 31 years of service, Brashear officially retired from the U.S. Navy on April 1, 1979.", u'This picture was made with the blessing and cooperation of the U.S. Department of the Navy.', u'The training ground for the diving school was filmed on the Columbia River, along the Oregon-Washington border. The Weyerhaeuser paper mill visible along the bank is in Longview, Washington. This site is currently a sheet rock factory.', u'The film\'s working title was "Navy Diver".', u'The year after this film was released, Cuba Gooding, Jr., portrayed Doris Miller, the first African-American to be awarded the Navy Cross, in Pearl Harbor (2001).', u'In Russian the title of this movie is, "Military Diver".', u'The library that Carl Brashear goes to study in is an original Carnegie Library built in Portland, Oregon. It now houses the Multnomah County Library Used Bookstore, The Title Wave.', u'The film cast includes three Oscar winners: Cuba Gooding, Jr., Robert De Niro, Charlize Theron, and one Oscar nominee: Hal Holbrook.', u'It is mentioned several times that Billy Sunday swam out of the St. Lo when she sunk. The U.S.S. St. Lo was an escort carrier, and the first major U.S. Navy ship to be sunk by a kamikaze. It happened during the Battle off Samar, part of the larger Battle of Leyte Gulf. The St. Lo and several other escort carriers, along with a handful of destroyers and destroyer escorts, held off a larger, and more powerful, Japanese task force, whose mission was to shell the Allied invasion force preparing to re-take the Philippines.', u"The character of Leslie Sunday played by denrio is based on two people in Carl's career.", u"In the hearing to determine if Senior Chief Brashear can remain a diver, his insignia is gold and Chief Sunday's is red. Chief Sunday has a record of bad conduct. Gold chevrons are used if an enlisted man has a good conduct record of at least twelve consecutive years."]

title: The Adventures of Rocky & Bullwinkle
plot_outline: When enemies Boris, Natasha and Fearless leader escape into the real world with a nefarious scheme, Rocky & Bullwinkle do the same and team up with a young F.B.I. agent to stop the trio.
keywords: [u'fbi', u'squirrel', u'moose', u'deforestation', u'lighthouse', u'based-on-tv-series', u'glowing-eye', u'awareness-that-one-is-a-cartoon-character', u'spoof', u'lifting-someone-into-the-air', u'reference-to-pbs', u'farce', u'breaking-the-fourth-wall', u'u.s.-president', u'road-comedy', u'part-live-action', u'satire', u'road-trip', u'spy', u'hypnotism', u'hollywood-sign', u'cartoon-reality-crossover', u'mad-scientist', u'part-animation', u'part-computer-animation', u'courtroom', u'actor-playing-multiple-roles', u'college', u'helicopter', u'pun', u'fugitive', u'self-referential', u'airplane', u'studio-logo-segues-into-film', u'inner-child', u'product-placement', u'internet', u'based-on-cartoon', u'hollywood-california', u'world-domination', u"catching-food-in-one's-mouth", u'celebrity', u'white-house', u'character-name-in-title']
taglines: [u"It's not the same old bull.", u'You will believe a squirrel can fly.', u'This Summer, Evil Meets Its Moose.', u'This Summer the real world is becoming a little more Animated.....', u'This Summer, the fur will fly, the moose will drive and the world will discover this is not the same old bull.', u'DeNiro...Russo...Alexander...Moose...Squirrel']
trivia: [u'This film was originally in pre-production in the early 1990s, with Danny DeVito and Meryl Streep set to play Boris and Natasha. Legal problems with copyrights prevented the film being made until several years later.', u'For the narration, Keith Scott is doing an imitation of the voice of the late William Conrad, who had been the narrator for the original animated adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle, Rocky and His Friends (1959).', u'Palm trees that were left on the Chapman University campus after the filming of Crimson Tide (1995) were covered and disguised as redwood trees.', u'Fearless Leader (Robert De Niro) says to Boris & Natasha "You talkin\' to me?...There\'s no one else here, so you must be talking to me". This is a reference to his most famous lines in Taxi Driver (1976).', u'The students in the film were actually real students of Chapman University, where part of the film takes place.', u"Kenan Thompson and Kel Mitchell, a comedy duo of the mid '90s, play Lewis and Martin respectively. A nod to another comedy duo, Jerry Lewis and Dean Martin.", u'When Fearless Leader is explaining a way to kill a cartoon character a spy asks him "What about that movie Roger Rabbit?" June Foray the voice of Rocky and Natasha starred in Who Framed Roger Rabbit (1988) as the voices of Lena Hyena and Wheezy the weasel.', u'The University infirmary is labeled "J. Ward", a homage to Rocky and Bullwinkle creator, Jay Ward.', u'The businesses lining the highways have some rather unusual names. Among them are "Lotta Room Motel", "Pump Her Up" (gas station), "Beefy Buns" (fast food), and (glimpsed briefly through the driver\'s window of the truck) "Boob Mart".', u"The name of Bullwinkle's alma mater is Wossamotta U.", u'Jason Alexander admitted to doing the movie strictly for the money.', u'As Fearless Leader, Robert De Niro, known for being a method actor, is the first actor to interpret a cartoon character as a method performance.', u'Joe Pesci and Cher turned down the roles of Boris and Natasha.', u'This was the last film from the Rocky and Bullwinkle franchise and the last to be a live action movie until 14 years later when Mr. Peabody & Sherman (2014) was released and became the first film to be a computer animated film for the franchise.', u'When Rocky and Bullwinkle arrive at Wossamata U, Keenan Thompson and Kel Mitchell\'s characters mention how the university has been live-action since 1964, once the show went into reruns. Keenan then turns to Kel and jokes, "That\'ll never happen to us, right?" To which Kel responds, "Right" as they wink at each other. Ironically, their show "Keenan and Kel" on Nick had just ended a month before the film\'s release, and went into reruns shortly after.', u"Rene Russo met June Foray at the film's table reading. By her own account, Russo was very nervous about taking on the role of Natasha Fatale and requested Foray to demonstrate the voice; Foray graciously obliged.", u"The young Karen Sympathy was played by Julia McAnuff' who's the young daughter of the movie director Des McAnuff.", u'Billy Crystal and John Goodman who played the Oklahoma cop and the mattress salesman would later star in the movie Monsters, Inc. (2001) as the voices of Mike and Sulley and would come out a year later after this films release.', u'Robert De Niro said in an interview that he only did this film purely for the money.', u'Monica Potter was originally cast as Karen Sympathy.', u";Keith Scott' used his same narrator voice that he previously did for George of the Jungle (1997) and later it's sequel George of the Jungle 2 (2003).", u'One of two films released during the summer of 2000 to feature both Piper Perabo and John Goodman. The other being Coyote Ugly (2000). They share the screen in both films.', u'June Foray, one of the surviving members of the original Rocky and His Friends (1959), who created the voice of Rocket J. Squirrel, does Rocky\'s voice for this film. She also recreates the voice of Natasha (when Natasha is in cartoon form) and her ubiquitous "old woman" voice from the old series as the voice of the narrator\'s mother.', u"The second Universal's live-action/animated hybrid film, after Balto (1995).", u"June Foray's second film from Universal Pictures after Problem Child 2 (1991).", u'As the Oklahoma cop is arresting Karen Sympathy, Rocky protests, "But she really is with the FBI!" The cop responds, "Yeah, and I\'m really John Goodman." This is an inside joke, because John Goodman is actually playing the cop.', u"Kenan Thompson's first live action animated film role. His next one is Fat Albert (2004).", u"Des McAnuff: The first person to turn off their TV after Bullwinkle's speech."]
release_dates: [u'USA::24 June 2000 (Universal City, California)\n (premiere)', u'USA::30 June 2000', u'Spain::6 October 2000', u'Brazil::13 October 2000', u'Belgium::25 October 2000', u'Hong Kong::16 November 2000', u'France::22 November 2000', u'Czech Republic::4 January 2001', u'New Zealand::4 January 2001', u'Australia::11 January 2001', u'UK::9 February 2001', u'Ireland::9 February 2001', u'Peru::15 February 2001', u'Portugal::23 February 2001', u'Iceland::9 March 2001', u'Lithuania::16 March 2001', u'Israel::29 March 2001', u'Sweden::6 April 2001', u'Poland::11 May 2001', u'Argentina::16 May 2001 (video premiere)', u'Germany::17 May 2001 (video premiere)', u'Denmark::8 June 2001', u'Greece::6 July 2001', u'Kuwait::19 September 2001', u'Egypt::16 January 2002', u'Japan::24 January 2003 (video premiere)', u'Hungary::17 August 2004 (video premiere)']

trivia: [u"Robert De Niro's face would sometimes ache for days after tensing his jaw to speak in his post-stroke scenes.", u'Rusty\'s line, "It costs a lot to look this cheap," is also a personal quote attributed to Dolly Parton.', u'The line "I\'m more of a man than you\'ll ever be and more of a woman than you\'ll ever get" was first uttered by Antonio Fargas as \'Lindy\' in Car Wash (1976).', u'When Robert De Niro read the screenplay, he had only one question for Joel Schumacher: "When do we start shooting?"', u'Joel Schumacher conceived the idea for the film from personal experience. One of his close friends suffered a series of strokes and had to relearn how to speak through singing lessons.', u"Co-stars Chris Bauer and Skipp Sudduth also co-starred in the television series Third Watch (1999), which debuted the same year as the film's release."]

taglines: [u"New York's most powerful gangster is about to get in touch with his feelings. YOU try telling him his 50 minutes are up."]
trivia: [u'It was very important to Robert De Niro that the movie felt authentic. He and director Harold Ramis would drive around Little Italy in New York looking for real people to cast.', u'Martin Scorsese was first approached to direct the film but turned it down.', u'According to Robert De Niro, he and Billy Crystal briefly toyed with the idea of co-directing the movie before deciding to offer it to Harold Ramis, who accepted.', u'Originally, the scene in which the couple is discussing their problems in bed with Dr. Sobel (Billy Crystal) was supposed to include only the woman and Dr. Sobel, but Crystal thought it would be funnier if the two of them were present. The man playing the husband is the head of the sound department for the movie, Les Lazarowitz, who being a heavyset guy made the scene even more comical. He deferred the sound mixing duties to his assistant while this scene was being filmed. Coincidentally, Lazarowitz was the boom operator (uncredited) in the fruit stand scene of The Godfather (1972), which is parodied in Analyze This (1999).', u'Robert De Niro suggested Chazz Palminteri for the role of Primo Sidone, having worked with him on A Bronx Tale (1993).', u'Robert De Niro picked out the shirt collars used by Vitti and his crew.', u'In the movie, Dr. Sobel dreams that he is shot by some gangsters while buying fruits from a fruit stand. This is a parody of a similar scene in The Godfather (1972) when Don Vito Corleone (Marlon Brando) was also shot buying fruits from a fruit stand. Coincidentally, Robert De Niro played a younger Don Vito Corleone in The Godfather: Part II (1974).', u"Every restaurant interior in the movie was the site of a gangland hit, with the exception of Sparks' Steakhouse, where the hit took place outside.", u'The character of Paul Vitti was loosely inspired by real life mobster John Gotti.', u'The bar scene with Dr. Sobel and Mr. Viti with the underwater mermaids was filmed at the B-Hotel in Ft. Lauderdale Florida. The bar in the hotel is still operating with "mermaids" that put on shows a couple of times a day.', u'In the original script, there were more scenes in which Dr. Sobel (Billy Crystal) receives gifts from Paul Vitti (Robert De Niro). In one of them, former Yankee great Phil Rizzuto, at the request of his friend Paul Vitti, would give Dr. Sobel his spike shoes because Dr. Sobel is a Yankees fan (which Billy Crystal is in real life).', u'Original director Richard Loncraine quit over creative differences.', u'The water fountain Paul Vitti gives Dr. Sobel as a wedding present is 40 feet tall and has a diameter of 24 feet.', u"In the scene when De Niro first goes to Billy Crystal's office, it was Crystal's idea to have De Niro pinch his cheek.", u'The sharks in the tank in which Billy Crystal was thrown into were actually digitally added in post-production; they were NOT real sharks.', u"The prison scenes at the end were actually filmed at New York state penitentiary in Sing Sing. The prisoners seen walking down the corridor at the beginning of the scene are real prisoners who belonged to the prison's drama club. The shooting at Sing Sing took only one day.", u'The scene towards the end in which all the Mafia bosses meet was filmed twice. The first filming occurred in Queens, New York. After watching the scene, Robert De Niro offered some suggestions, including that Dr. Sobel (Billy Crystal) "really belt" Jelly (Joe Viterelli). So the scene was filmed again, this time in Miami, Florida. In the final cut, the two scenes were merged. The shots of the scene in which a room full of people can be seen were taken in Queens whereas the shots in which Dr. Sobel is talking to Primo Sidone (Chazz Palminteri) and slapping Jelly were shot in Miami. There are only two or three people in the room for the scene that was shot in Miami.', u"Harold Ramis and Robin Williams who worked with Robert De Niro and Billy Crystal and each other on club paradise, died in 2014. Ramis died of a blood disorder virus and Robin Williams died of suicide due to depression and Parkinson's disease."]

taglines: [u'Your ally could become your enemy', u'The map is not the territory', u"How do you catch an enemy, When's he's your best friend", u'Loyalty is bought, betrayal is a way of life...', u'Anyone is an enemy for a price.']
trivia: [u'To make it look like Robert De Niro and Natascha McElhone were actually driving during the car chase, right hand drive cars were used, with the passenger side made up to mirror the real controls. The actors then mimicked the stunt drivers movements.', u'80 automobiles were destroyed during filming.', u'Skipp Sudduth requested to do his own stunt driving during the car chases and John Frankenheimer agreed. Frankenheimer told Sudduth "I don\'t wanna see any brake lights."', u'More than 300 stunt drivers were employed to give the real-time chase scenes an air of metal-crunching realism.', u"The figure skater, Natacha Kirilova, is announced as having won two Olympic and three world championships. She's played by Katarina Witt, winner of two Olympic and four world championships in figure skating.", u'The script originally called for Sam chasing Gregor in the arena to stop at the railing. However, at shooting, the stuntmen accidentally toppled over the railing, falling hard on the stone surface below. Director John Frankenheimer decided to leave the accident in the film.', u'Three of the actors from this film played villains in 007 films: Sean Bean in GoldenEye (1995), Michael Lonsdale in Moonraker (1979) and Jonathan Pryce in Tomorrow Never Dies (1997).', u'One of the stunt drivers was former Formula 1 driver Jean-Pierre Jarier.', u'In a 2008 readers poll conducted by CAR magazine, 4 cars featured in this movie merited ranks in the magazine\'s "Top 40 Coolest Movie Cars" issue: Audi S8 (9th), Citro\xebn XM & Peugeot 605 (24th) and BMW 535i (29th). Other featured vehicles included, Peugeot 406, Citro\xebn Xantia, and a (rare) Mercedes-Benz 450SEL 6.9.', u'The reference to the "man in the wheelchair" is referencing the book "The Bourne Identity" (1980) by Robert Ludlum; not the 2002 movie. The Man In The Wheelchair was M. Chernak, a mercenary broker that Jason Bourne killed.', u'To create the desired palette intended for the film, the art department was instructed to get props with mute colors. For crowd scenes, all extras were not allowed to wear any bright-colored clothes.', u'Porn star Ron Jeremy flew to Paris to film a small part in the film that was eventually cut by the studio.', u'David Mamet worked on the film as a script doctor. He significantly re-wrote the script, making major changes to character and dialogue from J.D. Zeik\'s original. There was a dispute between the studio, the director and the WGA over the credit, with MGM and the WGA insisting that Zeik be given story credit and billing over Mamet. They wouldn\'t back down and so Mamet asked that his name either be removed or placed under a pseudonym. The credits of the film now read as "Story by J.D. Zeik. Screenplay by J.D. Zeik and Richard Wiesz".', u"In Japan nowadays, 'Ronin' not only means a 'masterless Samurai', it also refers to students who haven't been accepted to a particular university and spend a year studying to take the entrance exam again the very next year.", u'During one of the car chase sequences where Gregor (Stellan Skarsg\xe5rd) is dictating directions to Sam (Robert De Niro) from a computer terminal, Avid film editing software - the software used to edit the film - is visible on the screen.', u'Almost all scenes were shot on location with the exception of two scenes. The opening scene used a set with the couple walking past the camera as the matching shot between location and set. The other one was the sequence between Sam and Vincent in the car right after the former was wounded. It was shot in green screen.', u"The 'fish in the barrel' scene was nearly scrapped when filmmakers encountered inconsistent weather over the period of 5 days. They instead settled for wetting the road and the car to give the impression that the place just rained. Also, even though there was a French by-law forbidding gunfire during photography during early-hours in the morning, the authorities gave special exception for the filmmakers.", u'The melancholic Ronin theme is played with an Armenian doudouk.', u'Sean Bean claims to be an S.A.S. veteran based in Hereford. In Bravo kaksi nolla (1999), Bean plays an S.A.S sergeant and mentions that Hereford is his home base. Hereford (on the England/Wales border) is the site of the S.A.S. regimental headquarters, known as Stirling Lines.', u'The first edition VHS in the United States mistakenly lists the film as having been released in 1997.', u'Director John Frankenheimer actually owned a similar brown Mercedes that was used in the second car chase scene. Although the script did not mentioned which car Vincent and Sam would use to chase the convoy, he suggested having the Mercedes being used in the movie.', u'This was filmed in Super 35 despite "Filmed in Panavision" being listed in the end credits. This has confused some people, however Panavision is a company which makes cameras and lenses and many films are made with Panavision equipment which are not not necessarily "Panavision" in the sense of "shot with an anamorphic lens made by Panavision".', u'Two of the actors later play fathers of main characters in the "Pirates of the Caribbean" franchise: Jonathan Pryce who plays Governor Swan, Elizabeth\'s father and Stellan Skarsg\xe5rd who plays Will Turner\'s father.', u'Early in the final car chase the drivers speed past a sign that reads "Auto Ecole" which is French for "Driving School."', u"A 'Ronin' is a samurai who is masterless.", u'The Christmas carol sung (in French) by a choir in the town square is "Now Is Born The Divine Christ Child", which is a traditional French carol from the 18th century.', u'Sean Bean and Jonathan Pryce both later appear in the popular TV series Game of Thrones.', u'Body count: 34', u"The contents of the silver briefcase is never revealed, making the briefcase a good example of a modern 'MacGuffin', a plot device often employed by 'Alfred Hitchcock'. A MacGuffin is an object that serves to drive the plot forward without having any importance in itself. As such, the object or its purpose often remain unidentified.", u'Vincent (Jean Reno) is the only mercenary that uses only one gun throughout the movie: a Beretta 92FS Inox.', u'In the part where De Niro is shot and has the bullet removed, he says the bullet was Teflon coated and that is why it penetrated the vest. Such bullets were sold in the USA until they acquired the reputation of "cop killer bullets" and were taken off the market.', u"The conversation between Sam and Jean-Pierre explains the history of the 47 Japanese samurais who became 'Ronin', masterless warriors betrayed by a feudal lord, who later took revenge against him. This plot was later loosely depicted in 47 Ronin (2013).", u'The original ending had Deirdre outside the cafe where Sam and Vincent are, thinking about whether she should enter or not before deciding against it. As she walks to her car, she is taken by the IRA, who she has betrayed, and who will (presumably) kill her. On his commentary on the DVD John Frankenheimer claims that the preview audience disliked the ending, saying that they did not want to see Deirdre die. A second ending was filmed where Deirdre walked away after Sam walked out of the cafe. According to Frankenheimer, this ending was also disliked by the preview audience who thought it was the set-up to a sequel and described it as too "Hollywood" (Frankenheimer agreed with them on this). While Frankenheimer liked the original ending, he conceded that with the investment MGM/UA had made in the film, they had to listen to the audience so the final ending, where Deirdre does not appear and her fate is left up in the air, was used. The original ending is included on the Special Edition DVD.', u"Like the cut near the start of the movie that transitions from on-location to the set of the caf\xe9, there is a similar cut at 1:04:59 that transitions between locations as Seamus is approaching Larry in the parked car. The passerby between the camera and Seamus obscures the transition. The first part of the scene takes place where Rue de la Bastille meets the Amphitheatre, the second part is in a small courtyard, with an Oleander, just up some steps, west of the Arenes d'Arles. At 1:04:59 Seamus is on the Rue de la Calade and and at 1:05:01 he is in the small parking court. This is the same court where Diedre enters the car to find Larry has been killed by Seamus, and Sam and Vincent arrive in time to see the car drive away, looking down at Larry's body. When the camera cuts back to Sam and Vincent looking down, they are actually back on Rue de la Calade.", u'Both Sean Bean and Jonathan Pryce appear in Game of Thrones. Both of their characters have been killed in the series.']

title: Great Expectations
plot_outline: Modernization of Charles Dickens classic story finds the hapless Finn as a painter in New York pursuing his unrequited and haughty childhood love.
keywords: [u'love', u'gulf-coast', u'florida', u'lawyer', u'girl', u'dance', u'1980s', u'painter', u'blonde', u'kiss', u'cigarette-smoking', u'art-gallery', u'mansion', u'motorboat', u'whisky', u'boy', u'escaped-convict', u'sketch', u'drawing', u'seagull', u'voice-over-narration', u'cat', u'wealth', u'escape-from-prison', u'eccentricity', u'heartbreak', u'long-take', u'kissing-while-having-sex', u'female-rear-nudity', u'kissing-in-the-rain', u'modern-day-adaptation', u'new-york-city', u'switchblade', u'murder', u'subway', u'fishing', u'revenge', u'fugitive', u'class-differences', u'spinster', u'based-on-novel']
taglines: [u'Let desire be your destiny.']
trivia: [u'The main character is named "Pip" in Charles Dickens\'s novel. But it was felt that the name would sound strange in modern times. The character was named "Finn" after Ethan Hawke\'s dog.', u'In his book, "What Just Happened?", producer Art Linson reveals that the narration in the movie was written by David Mamet. It was done for free, on the condition that nobody ever find out he did it.', u"Real life painter Francesco Clemente created Finnegan Bell's artwork for the movie.", u'Alfonso Cuar\xf3n always uses green (he even auditioned green eyed girls for A Little Princess (1995)) as the main color of his movies. He uses red and orange (complimentary and opposite colors) to make some remarks.', u"Ca d' Zan, a mansion in Sarasota, Fl, stood for Ms. Dismoor mansion. It once belonged to circus magnate John Ringling and his wife Mable.", u'In addition to co-writing, performing and producing the song "Siren" especially for this film, Tori Amos provided the vocalizations (whistling, breaths, etc.) that can be heard in the film\'s score.', u'Ethan Hawke later dissed the film, calling it "a lousy experience". He added that he felt he had been talked into making the movie, something he realized about a month into shooting which was then too late for him to pull out.', u'The film cast includes four Oscar winners: Chris Cooper, Anne Bancroft, Robert De Niro and Gwyneth Paltrow; and one Oscar nominee: Ethan Hawke.', u"Robert De Niro and Chris Cooper also appeared in Guilty by Suspicion (1991) and This Boy's Life (1993).", u"The green color appears in any unexpected forms, ways and objects along the entire movie. In latin traditions, the green color means hope, and the spanish title asigned for this production is 'Grandes Esperanzas'. 'Esperanza' is the spanish translation for 'Hope'."]
